title: Interesting history
text: Unfortunately, most of the rooms have been reconstructed as it was almost all destroyed during WWII. I'd still recommend for anyone who loves royal history

title: Great
text: We enjoyed the vastness of this palace . It was difficult to find the entrance . Lots of lovely clocks . We didnâ€™t see the theatre but everything else was o

title: Don't miss this palace!
text: We visited Munich's Residenz after finding it on TA. You can choose to tour the Treasury or Palace/Residenz or both (~â‚¬18/person). I recommend you do both. The Treasury portion provides an audio device in multiple languages.  Each of the exhibits has a number and you simply type it in to listen about it. The artifacts include crowns, swords, crosses and many/many it's really a must-see! The palace is really exceptional as well. Room after room of antiques used by the Bavarian royal families. Again, we loved this place--dont miss it! Wear comfortable walking shoes!!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Was exactlz what you expect
text: Love the place, however due to corona virus, will not be back.  I recommend visit once, but nothing special.

title: Beautiful palace
text: Such a beautiful palace in the middle of Munich! The staff was friendly even though still a bit confused about the whole new system they had to put in place for dealing with the new covid health restrictions.The rooms are beautiful, lots of things to see. I thought it's very good value for the money. We actually decided to buy the annual Schloss card and we're looking forward to visit other places :)
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Not to be missed!
text: Make time for this palace!! It was amazing to see, even with no prior knowledge of the history. Tourist information in Munich really underplays how stunning this place is. And itâ€™s an easy walk from Marienplatz. My only regret is that we had only reserved a few hours to see it. Plan to spend way too long in line for a ticket, but make sure to get a ticket to see the treasury as well. Some gorgeous crowns, etc there.

title: Huge- and quite magnificent!
text: So, I got really lost in here. It is huge. If you were to take the long tour and listen to every part of the audio tour I think that you could easily spend the whole day exploring it. The main part of the tour was incredibly interesting, with a large selection of items to few and learn about. If- like me- you enjoy exploring palaces then I can definitely recommend  a visit (however I must admit that Nymphenberg is more Instagram-able).

title: bella la residenza... la sala del tesoro non Ã¨ niente di che
text: Residenza molto ampia con diverse stanze in diversi stili.sicuramente da visitare se fate tappa a monaco.La sala del tesoro invece Ã¨ molto deludente.poca roba e niente di eccezionale.

title: Affascinante
text: Se andate alla Residenz vi consiglio di fare il biglietto da 13 Euro in cui Ã¨ compreso il Museo della Residenz, il Teatro CuvilliÃ©s e il Tesoro. Il biglietto puÃ² essere utilizzato anche in giorni diversi, ma vi assicuro che puÃ² essere tutto visto nello stesso giorno. All'interno del museo della Residenz si puÃ² anche scegliere di prendere l'audio guida. Il percorso Ã¨ meraviglioso poichÃ¨ ogni stanza della residenz ha una sua pculiaritÃ ! Anche il Teatro CuvilliÃ©s e il tesoro meritano di essere visitati!

title: Bellissima e interminabile esperienza
text: Ãˆ un enorme complesso che ha ospitato la casa regnante della Baviera (i Wittelsbach) per diversi secoli. Lâ€™edificio, in realtÃ , Ã¨ un insieme di edifici frutto degli ampliamenti successivi da parte dei principi che si sono succeduti. Entriamo alle 11:00 sapendo che ci aspetterÃ  una visita impegnativa; le stanze da visitare sono ben 130. Il costo del biglietto e di 11â‚¬ compresa lâ€™audioguida in italiano che ci viene consegnata, guarda caso, da una ragazza italiana. Per le foto non ci sono limiti. Cominciamo, cosÃ¬, il percorso guidato con lâ€™aiuto dellâ€™audioguida. Descrivere nel dettaglio tutta la visita sarebbe unâ€™operazione lunga e, pertanto, segnalo le cose piÃ¹ importanti: lâ€™Antiquarium, una grande sala affrescata contenente numerosi busti di imperatori romani, la camera del trono, la statua di San Giorgio ricoperta di una infinitÃ  di diamanti, la camera del tesoro, il Grottenhof con la fontana di Perseo e â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.... mi fermo qui. Ci aiuta molto lâ€™audioguida esaustiva e completa. Le ultime trenta stanze, sfiniti e con gli occhi pieni di tesori, le facciamo senza audioguida e a passo piÃ¹ svelto. Consegniamo le audioguide e dopo ben 4 ore di visita, stanchi ma soddisfatti, usciamo dal palazzo. Una esperienza davvero bella, da non perdere assolutamente.

title: Magnifica
text: Abbiamo visitato la residenza  il 30 dicembre con un tour organizzato compiendo la visita con la guida del tour, un po' troppo frettolosa, in circa 1h 30min. Da dire che ci vorrebbe il doppio del tempo, circa 3 ore, per poter visitarla bene e apprezzarne i suoi gioielli. La residenza Ã¨ stata per secoli il luogo di residenza e la sede del governo dei duchi, poi dei principi elettori e infine dei re di Baviera. E' enorme, ci sono una moltitudine di stanze, una piÃ¹ bella dell'altra. Che dire di piÃ¹: se visitate Monaco la visita Ã¨ d'obbligo.

title: KÃ¦mpe stort og meget flot slot
text: Det kan virkelige anbefales, at bruge et par timer pÃ¥ slottet. Det er meget smukt og meget stort. Man kan fordybe sig og se f.eks. en lille video om et skuffeskab osv. Det giver noget ekstra!  Der er ogsÃ¥ mulighed for at besÃ¸ge skattekammeret. Dette krÃ¦ver dog sÃ¦rskilt billet.

title: It's big. Probably bigger than Versailles
text: This place is dripping gold. Amazing opulence and architectural beauty. Did I say how BIG it is ?   The only negatives are that it closes quite early in the winter, and it can be hard to actually find the way IN

title: Awesome
text: The Residenz is a very large palace which is a must see. The insides are beautifully decorated with the rooms differently set out and richly ornate. The whole complex is extremely well presented with lavish furniture and beautiful pictures everywhere. Due to the size it does take some time to make the most of it at least 2 to 3 hours but every second is worth it.There is also the Treasury and the CuvilliÃ©s Theatre for which there is an extra charge to view. We did the treasury but missed the Cuvilles Theatre but if the main palace is anything to go by it should also be superb.You cannot go to Munich and miss the out the Residenz. It is well worth the investment of your time and effort

title: Gaste = flabbered
text: This place is monumentally huge! There is so much to see it is hard to know where to begin.Actually it was quite easy to know where to begin because a helpful member of staff pointed me in the right direction. But that isn't quite what I mean. What I mean is, it is difficult to know which bit to focus on first when writing about it, as there is so much, so very much.I bought a ticket for the Residenz and the Treasury and made my way in following red signs. I was guided from room to ornate room dripping with paintings, furniture, tapestries and assorted royal blingery any one of which you could write a book about. After a while (and I appreciate how ignorant this makes me sound) it all starts to blur into one and I found myself thinking "I'm sure I've been in this room before." The endless complex of rooms, corridors, chambers and antechambers had me wondering if when I came out I was going to emerge in Stuttgart.However, I made my way round what I think was most of the rooms that are open to visitors. I think there were about 16 million of them but I lost count part way. There were throne rooms (several) bed rooms (both ceremonial and for sleeping), reception rooms, a chapel, a room housing a collection of bronze statues, a room housing bizarre and unsettling religious relics, a room housing gold rings, two turtle doves and for all I know a partridge in a very royal pear tree. It's all a bit of a blur.While my comments may sound flippant this was part of the joy of visiting this site - and it really was a joy. You could let it all wash over you and just be blown away by the scale and richness of the rooms on display.Eventually I came to the end and noticed that I had done the tour without the benefit of the free audio guides. So I did it again.Occasionally I found myself standing back unable to decide if a room made mostly out of gold was either the most beautiful room I had ever seen or the most hideous. However, the one thing I was always sure about is that I wouldn't like to dust it.If you're in Munich and have a two or three months to kill you really must visit the Residenz. I have never been anywhere like it.

title: Excellent visit
text: Visiting in February was the key. Far fewer patrons than in high tourist times.Excellent exhibits and helpful staff.Very close to Marienplatz.

title: Must see
text: The Residenz is a huge complex with ornate and lavishly decorated state rooms, period furniture and paintings on par. You need at least half a day to stroll through the Museum and let these wonders sink in. The Treasury and the CuvilliÃ©s Theatre which charge separate admission fees offer equally dazzling sights and together they justify another half a day to complete a visit to the trio. If you miss them you havenâ€™t been to Munich!

title: Ein unentdeckter Schatz
text: TÃ¤glich lÃ¤uft man in MÃ¼nchen an der Residenz vorbei und die wenigsten wissen, was das fÃ¼r ein groÃŸer und unentdeckter Schatz sich hinter der Fassade verbirgt. Unbedingt mal reinschauen - und Zeit mitbringen, denn das Museum ist riesig und es gibt so viel zu entdecken. Have fun!

title: Worth a visit but it will take a couple of hours
text: Finding the correct entrance was challenging as sign posing is very poor. Once in we enjoyed the visit. Sumptuously decorated rooms that go on forever. Once your on the route you pretty much have to carry on to the end. Probably at least an hour and more likely two.

title: Residenz
text: This place has so much history. The entrance is in the main Residence plaza next to the theater and it has many buildings to see, museum, castle and theater. Get there early. They close at 5

title: Between a pearl and a diamond
text: Architecturally, it's between a pearl and a diamond - one does not know how else to describe this awesome building and the treasures it hides. Especially impressive is the Treasury (Schatzkammer), and the gardens, as well as the artificial cave with stalactites and stalagmites

title: Highlight of Visit
text: Iâ€™ve visited Munich several times over the years and somehow missed the Residenz even though itâ€™s in the heart of the city.   From the outside itâ€™s unassuming, but interior reveals wealth, history, and a world that has passed.  Much of the building and itâ€™s contents were destroyed during World War II and has been restored, other items are just empty highlighting whatâ€™s been lost.  I decided to just to the main self guided tour for 9 euros and spend almost 3 hours taking the long route.  The great hall early in is spectacular, many of the room transport you back in time.  I did skip or quickly walk through the endless rooms of table settings and vases instead looking at the art and furniture.   It was a great visit and something Iâ€™d not planned on.  Well with the visit.  Next time I may tour the theater and / or treasury (separate admission).   Highly recommended and a great cold or rainy day activity.

title: Belo palÃ¡cio
text: Ã‰ uma das visitas obrigatÃ³rias em Munique. De fato, Ã© um palÃ¡cio enorme e luxuoso que lembra o de Versailhes, embora seja maior, segundo disse um dos funcionÃ¡rios. Leva muito tempo para visitar, mas em janeiro estava bem vazio. Foi interessante ver as fotos da igreja anexa parcialmente destruÃ­da na 2a guerra, e como sÃ£o perceptÃ­veis os tijolos novos de algumas partes. Os jardins tambÃ©m sÃ£o lindos, ainda mais com neve.

title: Wet day
text: No better place to visit on a wet day. Only â‚¬9 entrance to see 130 beautifully presented rooms some of which are enormous. Easily spend a couple of hours here

title: Amazing Display of Wealth
text: We visited in the winter, so this turned out to be a great indoor activity for a cold, snowy day.  It was worth it to get the combined ticket (Residenz, treasury, opera theater) that came with a self-paced audio guide. Allot at least 4 hours to see all three; more if you enjoy digging into every single recording on the audio guide.  Room after room of tremendous royal wealth and pageantry are on display throughout the entire Residenz complex.  The grotto and Antiquarium are definitely the highlights.  There are also several ingeniously designed pieces of furniture in the rooms for the mechanically inclined.  As some have noted, much of the structure has been restored.  However, don't get too hung up over that. You'll be hard pressed to find anything in Europe that doesn't bear the scars of WWII.  What you see on display today includes the most important original pieces of art along with rooms were painstakingly recreated using original pieces saved from the war.  The antiquarium and grotto alone are worth the price of admission, and there is enough grandeur surviving from the restoration to impart a good sense what life must have been like during the time of the kings.

title: Nice but unfortunately not original
text: If you are into Baroque, this would be a great place to see. Unfortunately most of it was destroyed in WWII, so what you see is a great reconstruction job (which by the way has been done beautifully), but unfortunately very little of the original palace, itâ€™s furnishings and art have survived. It is, however, still very nice to see. There are 130+ rooms to see plus the treasury. We only had two hours to spare, so skipped the treasury (you can buy tickets for both together or separately at The Residenz, but not online). Two hours was not enough to do justice to the palace and we had to skip the audio guide too. So I would recommend 3 to 4 hours to do this place justice. Audio guides are available for free with the ticket, but if you are on express visit, you can get by reading fairly well done signage which is in every room in German and English.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Vale a pena
text: A maior residÃªncia real urbana. Vale a pena conhecer. Tire umas duas horas para fazer a visita. O PalÃ¡cio Ã© enorme. Cheio de obras de arte e conta a histÃ³ria da famÃ­lia real BÃ¡vara.

title: Una stanza dopo l altra
text: A pochi passi da marienplatz si trova il residenz Munich. L entrata Ã¨ di 9â‚¬ per vedere solo le stanze. Ci abbiamo passato tra le 2/3 ore all interno. Ottimo nei giorni di pioggia. Prevede anche un guardaroba a cui lasciare (obbligatorio) lo zaino, e in caso se si vuole anche la giacca. L unica pecca Ã¨ che non ci Ã¨ stato consigliato l audio per le descrizioni in italiano, il mio coniglio Ã¨ di richiederlo perchÃ© molto interessante. Noi ci siamo arrangiati a leggere le descrizioni in inglese e tedesco.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: What a place, just so many rooms!!!
text: Definitely a gem and well worth the visit. We saw only the main palace with the 130 rooms or so, but more than enough to be overwhelmed. We walked and explored the many rooms for hours and left in high spirits. It is a shame much of the palace was destroyed during WW2, but great restauration has been done, so you do not really sense this as you walk around. But you cannot help think about the amount of history and cultural value destroyed during wars.

title: DESLUMBRANTE
text: Fue el primer museo que vimos en nuestra visita a MÃºnich parecÃ­a no tan grande desde fuera pero realmente lo era.A la entrada del tour te piden dejar tus chaquetas en un depÃ³sito y te dan audÃ­fonos que puedes poner en cualquier idioma para ir escuchando en cada punto de interÃ©s.La residencia era deslumbrante, las pinturas en los techos, el mobiliario y las piezas, lo mejor la entrada como en cÃºpula salimos impresionados de cÃ³mo vivÃ­an pero luego fuimos a otros castillos y nos dimos cuenta que asÃ­ o mÃ¡s lujosos eran todos en aquellas Ã©pocas.

title: Grandissima!
text: Ci siamo recati in visita presso questa grandissima residenza reale, raggiungibile a piedi dal centro. Come giÃ  qualcuno ha fatto, consiglio di indossare scarpe comode in quanto ci sono ben 130 stanze da visitare con una comoda audioguida che ti danno gratuitamente. E' davvero imponente e ben tenuta, le stanze raccontano i fasti di una monarchia bavarese colta, giusta ed incline alla giustizia....E' difficile comprendere dove tutti i principi che si evincono da queste stanze siano stati smarriti negli anni precedenti alla seconda guerra mondiale...E' assolutamente da visitare!

title: Veloce
text: Residenza molto bella e anche molto grande peccato che essendo entrati alle 15.00 e il palazzo chiudeva alle 14.00 ci chiudevano molte stanze senza lasciarcele vedere e ci mettevano fretta per mandarci fuori... non si fa anche perchÃ© il biglietto lo abbiamo pagato intero e non per alcune stanze e basta.

title: superb!

title: Splendore reale
text: La Residenz Ã¨ uno dei palazzi reali piÃ¹ grandi d'Europa grazie alle sue 130 stanze tutte visitabili, lo splendido CuvilliÃ©s-Theater, la camera del tesoro e gli eleganti Hofgarten (giardini reali). Il biglietto cumulativo d'ingresso per vedere tutto questo splendore costa 17â‚¬ (attenzione al teatro perchÃ¨ apre solo dalle 14 alle 17, dunque se andate in mattinata vi faranno il ticket solo per palazzo e camera del tesoro a 14â‚¬ e se vorrete visitare il teatro dovrete pagare ulteriori 5â‚¬ all'ingresso di quest'ultimo).Armatevi di molta pazienza perchÃ¨ per visitare l'intero complesso ci vogliono 2/3 ore.La stanza che colpisce maggiormente il visitatore per sfarzo e raffinatezza Ã¨ sicuramente la galleria degli antenati con i ritratti dei piÃ¹ importanti membri della famiglia Wittelsbach dalle origini fino a Ludwig III l'ultimo Re di Baviera.La camera del tesoro ospita la corona, con lo scettro ed il globo, realizzati per il primo re bavarese e la cinquecentesca statua di San Giorgio, ricoperta da 2.291 diamanti, 406 rubini e 209 perle.

title: Highlight of Christmas
text: Christmas outside the Residenz is exciting and vibrant. So much to see . Montages and food stalls. Gluwein stands all in a great atmosphere. Special stands for children with moving parts
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Grandeur
text: The Munich Residence has been open to the public as a museum since 1920 and is one of the most important palace museums in Europe.The architecture and interior furnishings are of high artistic and material quality. The exquisite decorations of the rooms, furnitures, paintings, tapestries, treasures  are still in the place it was originally created for.

title: Expensive, Crowded and Fake
text: The Residenz was rebuilt after WW2 so most of what you see is from the 1940's and 50's.  The tour is self-guided and is supposed to take you through 133 rooms.  The rooms are beautiful and some of the furniture is exquisite but after a while, it all starts to blur together.  The posted closing time of 5PM was deceiving- at 4:20 they had already started closing up rooms and by 4:40 the guards told everyone to go down to the exit.  The line to collect our checked bags was ridiculously long- there was only 1 person there and many people in line did not speak German or English.  We had planned to go back a second day to see the Treasury and all the rooms we were not able to see but decided it was not worth it.

title: Residenz! Muito bem conservado
text: Muito luxo, coleÃ§Ã£o de obras de arte valiosÃ­ssima e muito bem conservado. Vale a pena comprar o bilhete completo. Nada cheira mofo. Demais.

title: Un posto incredibile
text: Il cartello all'inizio dice che ci vogliono due o tre ore. Aggiungerei MINIMO! Ãˆ davvero un posto enorme. Residenza nobile e reale. Piena di stanze incredibili. Troni, arredi, tutto qui Ã¨ maestoso e lussuoso. Davvero consiglio di venire! Il tesoro Ã¨ da non perdere. Stupendo!

title: Grandeur, opulence and beauty
text: Well worth waiting in line to get into the palace to  buy a ticket. This palace is big and there are a few flights of stairs. There is so much to see. We didnâ€™t do the audio tour, we opted to read the signs which were in German and English. The signs were very informative and I felt we could move about a bit quicker. We spent two and a half hours there which was adequate. The porcelain and silver collections were magnificent and hours could have been spent just looking at these. Itâ€™s well worth a visit and is an interesting historical site.

title: Merita la visita
text: BenchÃ¨ a prima vista, per la sua facciata, la "Residenz" sembri una bella copia del Palazzo Pitti di Firenze, la visita a questa storica dimora merita per poter ammirare i suoi interni, le magnifiche sale e le varie sontuose stanze di cui Ã¨ composta. Contrariamente a Palazzo Pitti il Residenz non Ã¨ una sede di esposizione di opere d'arte ma Ã¨ rimasto arredato cosÃ¬ come lo era quando era abitato dai suoi nobili ospiti e quindi si puÃ² avere una idea completa del tipo di vita che persone di alto lignaggio potevano fare.

title: A Must Visit
text: This is a very popular place, you need to be there at opening time to avoid the long wait. Give your self the whole day, there is so much to see. Well worth the visit

text: Hemos viajado a muchas capitales reales. Esta residencia debe visitarse para tener una idea muy aproximada de como eran y como vivÃ­an la realeza bÃ¡vara. Algunos espacios muy singulares.La visita que recomiendan es larga, pero nosotros la hicimos en menos de una hora, a paso ligero y entreteniÃ©ndonos mÃ¡s en los espacios mÃ¡s interesantes.

title: Meraviglioso
text: Bellissimo.Lo sfarzo, l'immensitÃ  delle sale lascia a bocca aperta appena si entra in ogni sala.Merita assolutamente la visita.Se devo trovare una nota negativa: l'audioguida, noiosa e ripetitiva, decisamente troppo lunga.

title: FÃ¼r einen Tag fast zu umfangreich
text: Die bayrischen KÃ¶nige haben es sich hier gut gehen lassen. Verschiedene Bauepochen vom 16.jh bis ins 19. hinein. Besonders beeindruckt hat mich, dass die Residenz in 2. wk stark beschÃ¤digt wurde (nur mehr 50mÂ² DachflÃ¤che waren noch intakt!) und danach wieder in den jetzigen Zustand hergestellt wurde. Die Narben und Hinweise darauf verfolgen einem auf Schritt und Tritt. Eine sehr beeindruckende Anlage, mit moderaten Preisen (Jugendliche bis 18 J. frei). Absolut sehenswert!

title: Reconstruction remarquable
text: On y retrouve la vigueur et la ferveur de la religion des prince d'alors, sans pour aurant y souscrire. Et des piÃ¨ces Ã©poustouflantes.

title: Vale la pena fare la fila per vederlo
text: Difficile descrivere la sensazione che sia ha entrando qui. Luminoso, maestoso e con attenzione ai dettagli. Se siete a Monaco andateci a tutti i costi.

title: A big maze
text: Prepare to spend at least a good 3hours navigating within. There are several hidden corners up and down within the Residenz. No doubt we were like rats in a maze. Moving up and down the staircase. The only part is the stairs are not all open and one wrong move to another area, you have to go back all the way to view.

title: Very Impressive
text: We visited the Residenz the day after we visited Nymphenburg Palace, which is a lot of Baroque style to take in in a short amount of time. The palace is beautiful, though as much of Germany was bombed during WWII, much of the Residenz is a replication as opposed to the original building. The building itself is beautiful inside, with ornate paintings, ceilings, furniture, and more.Unless you absolutely love Baroque style, try to schedule this at least 48 hours before or after Nymphenburg Palace, as it feels repetitive if you see them too close together.

title: Bello, ma quanto tempo...
text: Il palazzo ha degli interni effettivamente molto belli e nel prezzo del biglietto Ã¨ compresa l'utile audioguida in italiano. Va perÃ² detto che le dimensioni del palazzo e la quantitÃ  di stanze (alcune molto belle, altre meno interessanti) Ã¨ davvero enorme e anche cercando di tagliare vanno messe in conto minimo 3 ore di tempo. Insomma, se siete con i tempi tirati pensateci bene. La sezione con il tesoro della corona bavarese invece ci ha un po' deluso e a mio parere non vale l'extra di 4 Euro sul biglietto base.

title: Notevole
text: Non potevamo lasciare Monaco senza aver visitato la residenza reale. Consapevoli che ci sarebbe voluto molto tempo, abbiamo deciso di andare di mattina e abbiamo fatto bene perchÃ© tra la coda per i biglietti, quella per lasciare gli zaini e la visita al palazzo, con le oltre 100 stanze aperte al pubblico, al Tesoro e al teatro, ci abbiamo messo quasi 3 ore e mezzo.Non abbiamo preso l'audioguida, ma ci siamo orientati con il percorso segnalato e leggendo le descrizioni che ci sono in ogni stanza, il tesoro Ã¨ nello stesso edificio, mentre invece per il teatro bisogna uscire e spostarsi in un altra ala del palazzo.Noi abbiamo scelto il biglietto combinato per la visita completa che costa â‚¬13 per gli adulti, mentre per i minori l'ingresso Ã¨ gratuito

title: Luxo
text: A antiga residÃªncia do rei bÃ¡varo Ã© puro luxo. Nunca vi tanto ouro junto. SalÃµes e mais salÃµes riquÃ­ssimos, lindamente ornamentados. Chega a nos dar indignaÃ§Ã£o ao pensar que tanto luxo certamente custou a misÃ©ria de grande parte da populaÃ§Ã£o...

text: Get here early to avoid the queues! Itâ€™s an impressive collection of rooms and especially the hall and itâ€™s statues.

title: Don't miss it!
text: Very interesting and educational!Great pictures and great time to spend in rainny days. Do not miss!

title: Marvellous
text: Pity the tickets were only valid for one day. In order to able to appreciate the furniture & paintings and the excellent audio comment at least two days are necessary. Very interesting collection of roman statues - a must for classical trained scholars.

title: Una bella visita
text: Certo non Ã¨ il Louvre e nemmeno gli Uffizi, sarebbe stato piÃ¹ interessante forse con una visita guidata, magari in italiano visto il gran numero di connazionali. Comunque gradevole anche se non proprio la mia esperienza migliore nel genere..

title: Linda, porÃ©m repetitiva.
text: Lugar muito bacana, bonito e amplo. Mas Ã© muito amplo! Em dado momento fica repetitivo.Uma coisa que me incomodou Ã© o fato de venderem a atraÃ§Ã£o como a casa dos reis, rainhas e prÃ­ncipes. Seria um meio de vermos o estilo de vida que levavam. PorÃ©m, lÃ¡ dentro se descobre que muitos cÃ´modos nÃ£o tÃªm mÃ³veis e os que tÃªm, em sua maioria, sÃ£o rÃ©plicas, pois na segunda guerra mundial o palacio foi severamente destruÃ­do. Muito do que de vÃª Ã© reproduÃ§Ã£o, o que faz com que a atraÃ§Ã£o perca um pouco o seu valor.Mas tem bastante coisa legal para ver sim.Reserve ao menos duas horas.NÃ£o tem audio-guia em portuguÃªs, mas hÃ¡ espanhol e inglÃªs.

title: LOVELY BUILDING IN CENTRAL MUNICH
text: This was the original palace of the Bavarian monarchy in the 1500's.  It is right in the heart of the medieval part of Munich - literally 5 minutes walk from Marienplatz.  Entrance is not expensive (about Euros 7 ) plenty to see, amazing rooms (some were restored in the original style after WW2), the main hall is breathtaking in size and style.  Worth visiting and because of its position you can combine it with Christmas Markets, shopping or other sightseeing.

title: Magnificent Palace on par with Versailles!
text: This is a beautiful palace that is full of so many colorful and vibrant treasures! I visited for a few hours and even then I felt like I was rushing it, you probably need a whole day in order to digest the full magnitude of this enormous complex. The Antiquarium in particular is said to be the largest Renaissance hall north of the Alps and I made the comment to myself at the time that "I could stay in here all day," it is extremely gorgeous and is a photographer's paradise along with several other rooms in the palace. Absolutely a must see that you cannot miss in Munich!

title: Suntuosa
text: No recomendaron hacder una visita a la Residencia, y realmente valio la pena.Es un palacio en pleno centro de munich aparentemente sobrio, pero cuando lo visitas es impresionante.

title: Amazing Palace!
text: This place was truly amazing! It goes on forever! We recommend doing the Treasury first. It is smaller exhibit, but with all the Crown Jewels of Bavaria it is impressive. The rest of the palace is room after room of incredible tapestries, chandeliers and furnishings. The size of the place is overwhelming and it really isnâ€™t possible to visit in less than 2 hours. It isnâ€™t very accessible for those who have difficulty with stairs or a lot of walking.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Huge palace
text: We did the combo ticket for the palace, the treasury and the theater.  The treasury was perhaps best for those who have not visited other similar features in other countries and cities.  The theater was a surprising gem..really amazing.  The palace itself is gigantic.  We are glad we visited..do plan for enough time to take it all in.

title: Royal house in Munich...lots to see
text: The Residenz is the old royal house in Munich. It has been restored since the war and has many interesting rooms and collections. You are given three ticket options...single of just the resident part of the Residenz...double add in the treasury...and triple add in the theater. The theater was being renovated when I toured so I did the double. It takes some time to get thru, but the free audio guide is a plus and helpful. During December, there is a small Christmas market in one of the Residenz's courtyards.

title: Molto interessante
text: Non ho visto le sale del tesoro perchÃ© non c'era tempo, ma quello che ho visto mi Ã¨ bastato, certo che con il susseguirsi delle sale scema un po' la tua attenzione, Avevo l'audioguida datami da un simpatico inserviente italiano. Notevole  il cortile interno con la Grottenhof, poi l'Antiquarium , la galleria degli Antenati, a parte una statua del Canova segnalo 2 quadri del Canaletto con soggetto Nymphenburg. Poi devi uscire per entrare al Cuvillies teatro, bello indubbiamente.  Poi puoi ammirare le tre facciate del palazzo, tutte e 3 notevoli, quella che da su Hofgarten , i giardini dove in un angolo  i bavaresi giocano alla petanque, poi quella storica con i leoni e quella che sembra palazzo Pitti che da su Max Joseph Platz dove sorge a fianco il Teatro dell'Opera. Insomma vale la pena vederlo anche se impieghi quasi 3 ore.

title: Encantador
text: Visite com calma! Vale a pena conhecer um pouco mais da histÃ³ria e se encantar com as obras de arte.

title: Ok
text: Da visitare se si Ã¨ a Monaco, in quanto la spacciano come il miglior rinascimento in Germania. Se si Ã¨ stati a Firenze o in qualunque altra cittÃ  Italiana, questa Residenz non fa alcun effetto.Il complesso da visitare Ã¨ molto grande, quindi richiede avere il tempo necessario per farlo con calma

title: Based only Residence, Treasury likely adds to the tour
text: We only had about an hour to visit the Residence, so we decided to skip the Treasury. I think our visit would have been better if we'd included it and were not so rushed.However, we did enjoy it, the huge hall is stunning and worthwhile. The rooms all looked much the same after a while, and due to the War, a lot of it is not original.

title: HUGEE
text: This place is huge. After a while, maybe like 3 quarters way through, I decided to like give up and go back tot he entrances as I'm not that big on history and all and after a while, to me, it all look the same. The information given was really detailed with the audio guide given along with us. I especially like the huge hall

title: Prezzo onesto e visita piacevole
text: Considerando che a Monaco non c Ã¨ molto da vedere (eccezione per i mercatini di Natale molto carini in diversi punti della cittÃ ) vale la pena visitare questa residenza. C Ã¨ la possibilitÃ  di scegliere se visitare tutte e tre le parti in cui si divide la visita o scegliere quella che piÃ¹ interessa. Personalmente ho molto apprezzato la residenza in sÃ¨ e il teatro. Meno la stanza dei tesori (gusto personale). Tutto il tour dura circa 2 ore e mezza (molto di piÃ¹ se si decide di ascoltare tutto quello che descrive lâ€™audioguida). Audioguide disponibili in diverse lingue e gratuite. Prezzo per la visita completa 13 euro.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Residenza da non perdere
text: Ci vogliono 2/3 ore per vedere velocemente tutte le stanze...ne vale la pena, residenza grandissima e bellissima..vi farÃ  capire quanto erano ricchi i sovrani e quanto siamo poveri noi ai giorni nostri
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Excellent place to visit
text: My wife and visited here while in Munich. Fascinating place with excellent audio guide and signage in English

title: Well worth a visit to this beautiful residenz
text: The Residenz visit exceeded our expectations. It is well worth it to get the combined ticket to the museum, palace, treasury and Cuvillies Theatre. You are also able to photos without a flash.

title: bellissima
text: con gli amici abbiamo effettuato il tour completo e piÃ¹ ampio, le stanza della Residenza sono una piÃ¹ bella dell'altra, per visitatrlo con l'audioguida abbiamo impiegato piÃ¹ di tre ore

title: Interesante
text: Se trata de la residencia de la familia wittelsbach, sin duda la familia mÃ¡s representativa de la ciudad durante muchos aÃ±os, se creen descendientes de Carlomagno , se pasa por infinidad de estancias (como el antiquarium y la galerÃ­a de antepasados,)donde puedes ver mucho mobiliario de Ã©poca, En la sala del tesoro puedes ver multitud de joyas y objetos antiguos. En otra parte del complejo estÃ¡ el teatro cuville (yo no lo visite).

title: Fantastic value and some great history
text: We came to Munich for the Christmas markets and we had read about the Residenz.It doesn't look big from outside, but it is massive! There are some amazing artefacts on display, as well as information on the history of the palace.It cost us 7 euros each to enter. It took about 3 hours to get round everything.Really impressed that this piece of history has been restored following bombing in WW2.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: A pleasant afternoon in the Munich Residenz
text: If you like history and a real touch of royalty, the Residenz is easily worth a visit. Spend a half day exploring the historical home of Bavarian Monarchs.

title: Overwhelming Splendor!
text: I could not get over the size and scope of the Residenz.  You could spend an entire day here, especially if you listened to everything on the audio tour. (I suggest you don't.)  The ceremonial rooms and the royal treasury rooms were my favorites.  The opulence is mind-blowing.

title: Royal tour
text: We are not history buffs and have never seen inside a castle/ royal palace so it was fascinating for all of us. We were also only looking to kill an hour or two so weâ€™re pleasantly surprised how much there was to see and did not have time to finish the kings apartment. Very opulent, stunning and good audio for more information in your language when you want.

title: A great opulent castle to visit.
text: The tour was awesome.  Even my teenagers liked it.  It was easy to park nearby, even with a RV.  I used to live near Wurzburg, and never went there.  Glad I finally did.

title: PrÃ¤chtiges Schloss mit groÃŸer Sammlung an SchÃ¤tzen
text: Wir hatten das Kombiticket mit Schatzkammer, was uns locker fÃ¼r einen ganzen Tag gereicht hÃ¤tte. Allein die Anzahl an verschiedenen RÃ¤umen fÃ¼r die HerzÃ¶ge und KÃ¶nige Bayerns, auch das Antiquarium in wunderbar restauriertem Zustand, verschlug uns fast die Sprache. Wir fÃ¼hlten uns fast wie in den kapitolinischen Museen in Rom.Sehr beeindruckend auch die Sammlung an Reliquien - sehr speziell - und die Schatzkammer mit ihrer Sammlung. Dabei gingen die ganzen Bilder und Raumausstattungen nahezu unter.Schade nur, dass man ins Museum nichts zu essen/trinken mitnehmen darf. Das kÃ¼rzt den Aufenthalt natÃ¼rlich gezwungenermaÃŸen ab.

title: Lindo mais cansativo
text: EsplÃªndido museu , acervo imenso sobre a histÃ³ria da aristocracia alemÃ£ do sÃ©culo 15 ao 19 , mas ... aja perna ... tire trÃªs horas sendo rÃ¡pido e cuidado com horÃ¡rio no inverno , e mais curto

title: Molto bella
text: Davvero emozionante. Le ultime sale sono favolose e solo quelle meritano tutto il prezzo del biglietto.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Que lugar lindo!
text: Aqui vocÃª poderÃ¡ presenciar a riqueza da Baviera, A ResidÃªncia de Munique Ã© espetacular, realmente um PalÃ¡cio. O ingresso para a visita aos cÃ´modos custa 7 euros e a visita dura de acordo com seu interesse, acho q em umas 3 horas dÃ¡ pra rodar tudo sem ser muito detalhista. Junto com o ingresso estÃ¡ incluÃ­do o sistema de Ã¡udio descriÃ§Ã£o dos ambientes, o que ajuda muito a entender o que Ã© o que. Vale a visita, um passeio histÃ³rico/cultural sobre a famÃ­lia real da Baviera.

title: DonÂ´t miss it!
text: From the outside it is an old but not so impressing large building. But dont miss to visit the inside. It is spectacular! Expecially the big hall with the antique statues. To visit you will need at least 2 or 3 hours.

title: Too historical landmark in Munich
text: We spent four hours touring this place and we could easily have spent few hours more.  Definitely one of the top historical landmarks in Munich.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: A great museum to visit
text: I love historical architecture and learning about lifestyles and this museum did not disappoint.  While most of the residence was destroyed in WWII, "they" have done an amazing job at rebuilding and restoring.  The self-guided tour is well worth the entrance fee and always seemed to keep going and going.  The history of the families that lived there was valuable information as well.

title: a day out
text: Residenz  is a fantastic place  and is well worth the time we were hear before and again loved it the statues and art is so mind blowing walking the way through the tunnel and i must say this time cheaper to by a group ticket than individuals we loved it all 4 of us and it was enjoyable worth the visit

title: Well Worth the Time
text: What can I say? If you've got a couple of hours in Munich then this is the place to go. OK so eventually you'll get somewhat punch drunk from seeing so many rooms full of oppulance but there are some real gems.I'd not expected a gem like this in Bavaria, which is my fault. Its got hints of Versailles, St Petersburg and Salzburg all rolled into one.It costs about the same as a pint of beer to visit. If you think that's too much, well you have your answer.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Really enjoyable visit
text: We enjoyed our tour of the Residenz! We were there for opening hour, bought our tickets (cash only!!) and got our audio guides. THere's a cloakroom/baggage area to leave coats and bags/backpacks above a certain side. We strolled around the Residenz. There was a lot of detail in the audio guide - to be honest, almost too much detail sometimes.  Allow sufficient time for visit - at least 2 hours for comfort.

title: Veramente notevole
text: Residenz si trova a pochi passi da Marienplatz ed Ã¨ una visita imperdibile. Preparatevi perÃ² a camminare parecchio perchÃ¨ il palazzo Ã¨ immenso. Ci sono due tour differenti (mattina o pomeriggio) che consentono di passeggiare da una stanza all'altra ammirando arredi sfarzosi nei luoghi dove hanno vissuto diverse dinastie di imperatori. Nulla da invidiare, per quanto riguarda gli interni (non ci sono giardini paragonabili a Versailles, Shonbrunn o Caserta) ad altre famose residenze reali.

title: Tarihe yolculuk
text: Tahmin ettiÄŸimizden daha bÃ¼yÃ¼k ve iÃ§i dolu bir sarayla karÅŸÄ±laÅŸtÄ±k.AlmanyanÄ±n tarihi ve saray hayatÄ± hakkÄ±nda doyurucu bir yapÄ± buraya gelmeden dÃ¶nmek eksiklik olur bence

title: Incredible details
text: We didnt know what to expect but were struck by how reasonable it is to enter. We used the audio guides in each room, and really enjoyed the visit. So much to see and take in. But its tiring and took a really time to get round. Its incredible to see the restoration after so much was destroyed in the second world war. Definitely worth a visit and really rounded off our trip to Bavaria.

title: Agotadora
text: Residencia de los gobernantes de Baviera. es un recinto enorme y se necesita bastante tiempo para verlo bien. La ayuda de las audioguÃ­as sirve para mucho aunque ofrecen demasiada informaciÃ³n para un espacio tan enorme
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: not to be missed
text: a visit to remember.A lot to see from crafts, artisan, tapestaries, furniture, crown jewels silver and goldware

title: Impressive restoration after WWII.
text: I normally avoid museums like this because honestly if youâ€™ve seen one they tend to be all the same: furnishings, architecture and often similar lay outs.  But since this is mostly a restoration the vibrancy of the colours in the wall hangings and decor are wonderful.  The treasury is worth a visit to see the variety of bejeweled crowns and ceremonial swords and religious items. A nice way to use up 2 hrs in central Munich

title: Upea rakennus
text: Hieno rakennus Baijerin kuninkaitten ajalta. Huoneita oli paljon vaikka kiersimme lyhyemmÃ¤n lenkin. Talvella aika viileÃ¤ paikka.

title: Se avete tempo andateci
text: Solo 7 euro e minorenni gratis con servizio audioguida gratuito. Interessante palazzo con splendida collezione di mobili quadri e porcellane di diverse epoche. Almeno due ore per poter apprezzare il tutto

title: Good to know the history of Bavaria
text: We visited and viewed 100s of rooms there and came to know about the history of Bavaria, you can also combine the visit with Cuvillies Theatre

title: Weekend in Munich
text: Outstanding!!Huge palace in the old city,royal residence of the bavarian kings!!If you are in Munich,you can't lose it!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Grandissima e affascinante
text: Per effettuare la visita completa occorrono almeno tre ore. Il biglietto costa 11 euro compreso anche le sale del tesoro. Visita comprensiva del teatro Cuvilles 13 euro,solo che quest ultimo apre  alle ore 14. Ãˆ una struttura imponente e grandiosa, come si sa Ã¨ stata per la maggior parte ricostruita dopo i bombardamenti ma ne Ã¨ stata conservata l originaria bellezza e lo stile. Il percorso della visita Ã¨ ben strutturato. Ãˆ veramente un capolavoro da non perdere!

title: Incredible Visit - but little is orginial
text: I didn't give myself a great deal of time to experience this as I got there 90-minutes before closing. I decided to tour the main part of the museum and it was worth it just to see the incredible hall which is the first thing you walk into. I used the free audio guide and learned that most of the items were not originals as a result of heavy bombing during World War II. For that reason, I wish I would have skipped this part and visited the Treasury which houses jewelry and other cool items. I'm happy that I went but I would defiantly recommend doing the Treasury if you are short on time, especially if you've visited any other royal residence in Europe.

title: Christmas Market in Residenz Munich Weihnachtsdorf in der Residenz
text: Christmas Market in Munichâ€˜s city castle, Residenz. Itâ€™s a small intimate Christmas market .Not too touristy. Sow casing both traditional and non traditional food and drink stalls .It has a MÃ¤rchenwald ( enchanted forrest) which young and old will enjoy .

title: Als Katholikin kenne ich mich mit Reliquien aus
text: Als Katholikin kenne ich mich mit Reliquien aus, war aber nicht darauf vorbereitet, ganze KÃ¶rperteile - unter anderem - zu schmÃ¼cken und fÃ¼r den Gottesdienst zu schmÃ¼cken. Ich hatte noch nie von SchÃ¤delreliquien gehÃ¶rt, aber es waren mehrere ausgestellt. Wenn liturgische KÃ¼nste von Interesse sind, sollte dies eine groÃŸartige Sammlung zum Nachlesen sein ... ansonsten sei nur gewarnt

title: FantÃ¡stica
text: Una de las visitas mÃ¡s sorprendentes, es enorme, estuvimos casi toda la maÃ±ana recorriendo las diferentes estancias de los electores y los reyes de Baviera, tiene un museo del tesoro con piezas desde el siglo XIII, una galerÃ­a de retratos y una galerÃ­a donde ubicaban las piezas arqueolÃ³gicas, todo en un recorrido lineal . Muy muy recomendable
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Very good
text: Very nice. It only lacks in explanations in english but that is common in Munich. Perhaps a little improvement in the light would make it perfect

title: Great Palace but surly staff
text: Tastefully restored with so many rooms to explore and enjoy, this former Palace is situated in the heart of Munich between Marienplatz and Odensplatz stations. Audio guides are includes in the admission price and are worth using as you tour the Palace. Leave all bags in the cloakroom except for small purses. Apart from the front of house staff where public interaction is needed at a higher level , most of the staff were either grumpy or downright rude to visitors. I observed staff telling guests off for standing too close to doors or windows and my husband was told to leave the area outside the toilets when he was waiting for me. Take at least 3-4 hours to enjoy the Palace plus extra time for the treasury and theatre.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Enormous and lavish
text: This is very much worth the visit but do leave plenty of time as there are 120 or more rooms to visit.  The Antiquarium (pictured above) is worth spending some time in.  The museum uses arrows to help guide you around so you can easily keep your bearings.  It was surprising how many original art works were destroyed and had to be replaced.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful and huge. Free audioguide. Tons to listen to. I brought my own headphones to plug into audioguide. I spent about 2 hours. Places to sit along the way to appreciate the rooms. Great activity for cold or rainy day. There is a bag check where they make you check your bag. Would strongly recommend.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: A must in Munich
text: Worth to visit! The outdoor is beautiful  as well as inside the museum. The tour is about max 3 hours. We find it too detailed but of course history lovers would love all the details.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Fascinante.
text: Lujo a raudales. Pero creo que como cerraban a las 17 h. estaban restringiendo salas o Ã¡reas de visita porque nos dio la impresiÃ³n de que no visitamos las 130 que dicen que hay...

title: Mixed bag
text: The Treasury was wonderful and the CuvilliÃ©s Theater was exceptional. The Residenz Museum was so big and so boring! Every room was opulent and few of them were interesting. I ended up doing a sort of speed walk.

La visita Ã¨ piacevole e viene fornita, compresa nel prezzo del biglietto, un'audioguida esauriente e semplice da usare. Si possono seguire vari percorsi ma si puÃ² anche "perdersi" seguendo le tante frecce che si trovano lungo il percorso.

title: Amazing
text: This place is amazing. Must see if you want a glimpse back in time. I did the tour with the audio. You cannot bring backpacks but they have a place to check your bag and coat Make sure you hold onto the audio if you decide to do the residence and the treasury tour. That communication was not given to me. Definitely worth the time. Plan to spend a few hours here if you want to listen to all the audio.

title: A must see in Munich
text: We had a great time here, the Treasury was amazing, loved the crowns and jewelry. Definitely a must see. Very good English Audio Tour.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: magnifique
text: palais Ã  visiter si vous Ãªtes Ã  Munich, chÃ¢teau des Ducs de BaviÃ¨re. Il est richement dÃ©corÃ©, c'est superbe ! dans la salle des trÃ©sors vous verrez des piÃ¨ces exceptionnelles.

title: Impressive but prepare for lots of leg works
text: Best place to go for a rainy day.This 130 rooms Palace is impressive, and to see it all, you need 2-3 hours, and lots of leg work. The original palace was destroyed but the reconstruction looks authentic and with the free self guide, you could have a great time here. And if the weather is fine, don't forget to walk round the Palace garden.

title: The Residenz
text: We took so many beautiful photos. Be sure to go to Treasury too.  So many rooms with such beautiful furniture & fabrics everywhere

title: Great place to see!
text: Incredible art and rooms  to view. A nice way to see the building, set up well, not crowded in Oct! Fabric wall paper is amazing. :)

title: Lovely palace with an interesting history
text: I'm not sure what I expected when I decided to visit the Residenz, but I can tell you that it exceeded my expectations. There was the usual room after room of beautiful interiors, many similar to other palaces I have visited. What made this special is some of the interiors and rooms (such as in the photo) unlike any other rooms I have visited and were interesting both architecturally and artistically. The main reason I gave this attraction only 4 out of 5 stars is that much of the palace is very difficult to navigate if you are mildly disabled (and definitely not wheelchair friendly). Many of the stairways did not have rails to hold on to, and when you use a cane, and have problems with balance, the stairways were more challenging than I would have liked. However, even with these limitations, if you are up to the challenge, this palace is well worth your time.

title: Residencia del reino de Baviera.
text: Para conocer la cultura e historia del reinado de Baviera desde el 1.600 en adelante. Se puede recorrer la capilla, los aposentos y otras partes del palacio, el museo de porcelana y del tesoro de la  dinastÃ­a. Lo mÃ¡s impresionante es el antiquarium con su imponente colecciÃ³n de esculturas griegas y romanas. TambiÃ©n es interesante visitar el teatro CuvilliÃ©s de estilo rococÃ³.

title: Unbedingt das Kombiticket nehmen!
text: Dem Besuch in der Residenz ist nichts entgegen zu wirken. Ein muss eines Touristen der sich fÃ¼r die Kultur der Bayern interessiert. Man sollte sich mindestens 4-5 Std Zeit nehmen.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Spend Half a Day
text: This is not a site to breeze through.  Many very interesting exhibits and the audio guides are very detailed.  A must for anyone visiting Munich.  The chapels are extraordinary.

title: The Height of Opulence
text: This Royal Residence was destroyed in WWII to a large extent, but great care has been taken to restore the many rooms and decorations to their previous glory, with great success. An audioguide in English is included free with the entry fee, but you'd have to know this as no one tells you when you pay. We found it helpful, and that it added to the interest of the visit considerably. I took my folding walking stick seat, and I was very glad to have it as there are long stretches with nowhere to sit down. There are also many seats, but the Residence is very large, and the complete tour took us all afternoon. We fitted in a visit to the Treasury in the last half hour it was open, and I would recommend that, as there are some beautiful things, beautifully presented in there.  After a while I began to feel the wealth and extravagance of the decor and furnishings just got a bit too much, and on reflection, I think the short tour might have been a better idea.  The visit has left a lasting impression, as much for the quality of the restoration as for the building itself.

title: One of my favorite tours
text: So much to see!  Such extravagance, over the top decorations.  We actually got lost and confused several times it's so big!  We think we only saw about 2/3 of it but we were there for hours and tired of walking.  I call this a "must see"!  For me it was better than any castle tour we took.

title: HUGE
text: While this palace is extremely interesting and beautiful, it is just so huge.  One can hardly get through the whole thing without being worn out.  Also, the signage is fairly well done and the route easy enough to follow.  There are restrooms along the way.  We paid for entrance to the theater but then were unable to see it because the opening of it was delayed and our day was already very long.

title: great place to visit with limited time in munich
text: it has the best between the amazing jewels of the crown and living quarters of the Bavarian royalty. lots to see - well worth it when you don't have several days in Munich.

title: Beeindruckend
text: Es ist sehr beeindruckend , hier sind viele RÃ¤ume zu besichtigen und sehr erstaunlich, wie die FÃ¼rsten in der damaligen Zeit zusammen mit dem Volk gelebt haben . Man mÃ¼sste all diese SchÃ¶nheiten erleben...

title: Regale e enorme
text: 1. Si arriva facilmente con metropolitana (pochi passi dall'uscita)2. Costo veramente ridotto (e. 7,00) per la residenza  (2 livelli) che Ã¨ enorme e la cui visita richiede tanto tempo3. Audioguide in italiano (!!) e gratuite (incredibile)4. Deposito zaini all'ingresso gratuito5. Numerosissime stanze e saloni di una bellezza incredibile (la maggior parte ricostruiti) con arredi, arazzi, dipinti, ecc. ecc.6. La visita all'interno si divide in percorso breve e lungo..richiede veramente molto tempo ma ne vale assolutamente la pena!

title: Sehr interessant
text: Die Residenz ist sehr interessant, man sollte jedoch viel Zeit mitbringen, bzw. bei einem einmaligen Besuch ist es sehr viel, man sollte doch Ã¶fter hingehen. Besonders interessant ist die Porzellansammlung.

title: WOW
text: Incredibile come questa Residenza sia grande, piena di stanze, bisognerebbe stare tutto il giorno qui!

title: Nicht entgehen lassen
text: Ein MUST fÃ¼r MÃ¼nchenbesucher. Einfach Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigend. Aber Besuch gut planen. MÃ¶glichst zu Randzeiten. Aber auf jeden Fall nicht entgehen lassen.

title: Da urlo
text: Palazzo reale di Monaco ricostruito dopo la seconda guerra mondiale in quanto bombardato pesantemente.  Realistico per quanto possibile e per quanto recuperato. Stile rococÃ² a magnificare la casa reale in ogni dove. Con 13 euro si accede alla visita  completa e ne vale la pena.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Mehr als erwartet
text: Wir haben die Residenz in MÃ¼nchen besucht und waren sehr beeindruckt. FÃ¼r den kleinen Eintrittspreis bekommt man wirklich viel geboten und wir waren 2 Stunden gut beschÃ¤ftigt obwohl wir relativ schnell alles besichtigt haben.Einen Besuch wÃ¼rden wir empfehlen!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Gorgeous Golden Palace--Better Than Versi!!!
text: Gorgeous!!!  Gorgeous!!!  Gorgeous!!!And we WERE allowed to take picures and videos.MANY, MANY rooms with GOLD MOULDING EVERYWHERE.  Spectacular MIRRORED WALLS and DAMASK WALLS.   Massive CHANDELIERS!!!Every room we saw , we said     THIS MUST BE THE LAST ONE!!!But, then we entered another one.   Must have been 40 to 50 GOLDEN HUGE HUGE HUGE rooms filled with GOLD WALLS, CEILINGS, and MORE!!!We were SHOCKED because the OUTSIDE was PLAIN and NOTHING to see.IF in MUNICH,     MUST    MUST   MUST    see.Buy ticket that allows you to see the OPERA House.WOW   WOW    WOW!!!They do have performances there.  When you visit, check the schedule before your visit and BOOK a performance of ANY kind in that LAVISH Theater.   Opera--Ballet--Symphonic Orchestra.We were disappointed that there was NOTHING at the theater while we were there.But WE and OTHERS just sat in the seats and enjoyed for 15 to 20 MINUTES.If you stay in a hotel in the ring, it is an easy walk to this palace.  It is in the HEART of the SHOPPING area.

title: A must!!
text: Iâ€™ve been here a few times during the last 25 years and it has never let me down. This palace is like a good book with simple cover. The more you explore, the more you appreciate the place. Also the restoration works were non stop so the palace is in amazing condition.The price wasnâ€™t cheap and they also have Treasury and Opera sections that required more money. But itâ€™s worth the money. My 5 years old son wasnâ€™t easy to please and he enjoyed it here. The location is at the centre. Itâ€™s a must when you are in Munich.

title: Para los que disfrutan la historia
text: CÃ³mo la mayorÃ­a de las cosas en MÃºnich, mucho no es original, sin embargo se puede apreciar la vida de ese entonces para esa clase social. Tickets se ve den de acuerdo a las zonas a visitar. Es enorme. Guardarropas y depÃ³sito de mochilas al ingreso. BaÃ±os disponibles en los distintos pisos, sin costo. Venta de recuerdos.

title: Interesting and well displayed of royal residence and arts
text: Fantastic visit and we came here on a rainy day which help us stay dry while learning about the architecture and decoration/ furnishings. It is the place that you wouldnâ€™t want to miss with you are in Munich
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Large museum
text: On the exterior, it looks boring and uninviting. The inside, despite many are reconstructed post war, are very interesting. There are so many to see and long corridor with opulent decoration.the entrance fee is considered cheap.

title: A Blast to The Past
text: Make sure you get to the residence bright and early (the moment the open) to truly enjoy and experience all of the tour...otherwise you'll end up having to rush/mad dash throughout the palace. Well worth a visit, absolutely beautiful architecture and sights! One of my fav places we visited in Germany!

title: Bonito palacio
text: Bonito palacio en el centro de MÃºnich.La entrada no es muy cara y la visita lleva toda una maÃ±ana.Audioguia gratuita en todos los idiomas.HabÃ­a muchas personas guiÃ¡ndote para no perderte, pero lo que no me gustÃ³ era que yo habÃ­a un par de salas que no querÃ­a visitar y me obligaron a pasar por ellas...porque tenÃ­a que verlas todas.
visitor_origin: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain

title: A huge museum showing so many rooms
text: I have toured many castles and palaces but have never seen so many rooms. Some of the rooms were being actively worked on so we could see the detailed hand painting in the renovation process. Many pieces of furniture that were actually used by the royalty. Good audio guides.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Just for the Jewels
text: We only went to the Treasury to see the Wittlesbach's jewels.  They are incredible!  I enjoyed this more than the Green Vault in Dresden.  There are also treasures from their tables (gold and silver serving pieces) and interesting things that they have collected over the years.

title: precious memory of king ludwig II
text: world war II demolished this beautiful palace of the bavarian king ludwig II. still the remaining is simply beautiful. if you are in munich take a stroll there.

title: A real jewel
text: Due to a delayed flight, we found ourselves with an extra morning in Munich, so we took the opportunity the check one last thing off my to do list. I am so glad we got to spend some time in the Residenz, because it is one of the most drop-dead gorgeous structures I have ever had the pleasure of visiting.

title: Viele RÃ¤ume zu besichtigen
text: Insgesamt sind wÃ¤ren des Besuches sehr viele RÃ¤ume zu besichtigen. Durch die zur Zeit laufenden Renovierungen scheint es aber ein wenig chaotisch bei der RaumfÃ¼hrung zu sein. Es gab eher provisorische Hinweisschilder und selbst gemalte Schilder. Auch musste man RÃ¤ume mehrfach durchlaufen um wieder weiter zu gehen zu kÃ¶nnen. Dies hat das Erlebnis stark getrÃ¼bt. Manche ErklÃ¤rungen waren genau auf der anderen Seite des Raumes angebracht und somit verstÃ¤rkte sich der Eindruck eine Provisorium. Auch macht die Residenz nicht genug aus ihren MÃ¶glichkeiten. Zu viele RÃ¤ume sind nicht ganz wieder hergestellt und mit einzelnen MÃ¶beln ausgestattet. Es entsteht der Eindruck es geht mehr um die Anzahl als um die QualitÃ¤t. Die wirkliche Highlights sind herausragend aber gehen auch etwas unter. Vielleicht wÃ¤re nie neue Ãœberarbeitung mal ein Thema? Der Audioguides war durchweg gut und arbeitet mit Musik und verschiedenen ErzÃ¤hlern. Trotzdem lohnt sich der Besuch auf jeden Fall.

title: Amazing museum
text: This museum is huge and comes with extensive audio guide included with your ticket. The audio portion of the treasury has 5 hours of material (minimum time 30 minutes) if you wanted to listen to everything.  You could spend days in this museum which is really a tour through all the palace rooms. A great place for history buffs.

title: Two alternatives
text: You can tour the rooms or tour the crown jewels, or both. We toured the crown jewels with an audio guide.  All very good. A history lesson as well as seeing precious things. Folks are friendly,  so much so that we were escorted by a guide up an elevator to the restrooms.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Awesome but Overwhelming
text: An amazing residence.  Huge and a lot of walking - be prepared.  Luckily there are seats along the way.  I think many of them are for the staff but go ahead and use them!  Did the Treasury first and then the Residence, and used the audio guide.  Most all signs also were in English so you can do without the audio guide, but it in included in the price so we used it.   Overall we spent about 5 hours here.  Never did get to see the theater and we could not find it, as several others were also wandering about looking for it.

title: Beautiful but overwhelming
text: This is a beautiful place and good value for money, but 130 extravagant decorated and furnished rooms are more than my friends and I could fully appreciate. The audio guides are helpful but I found that I often wished to have information about an item that wasnâ€™t mentioned. Definitely worth a visit when in Munich.

title: Incontournable!!!
text: Le palais des Ã©lecteurs puis des rois de BaviÃ¨re recÃ¨le de somptueux amÃ©nagements et une collection de porcelaine magnifique.

title: Royal Rabble
text: The Munich Residenz is better as a museum than a palace.Open to the public for 6 euros is pretty good value for money - as a tourist.  The decadence and opulence needs to be seen to be believed.  An unimaginable level of wealth.Thankfully the previous owners forgot to pay the rent and have since left.  The rightful owners have taken possession of the building which now serves as a museum and a reminder of how the other half live.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Imperdibile!!!
text: Ci vorrebbe un intera giornata per godere a pieno della bellezza che questo luogo esprime. Ti catapulta indietro nel tempo fra lussi e sfarzi nobiliari. Bellissimo

title: Fascinating exhibits
text: Many outstanding art of all kinds... a true sensory experience and the photos youâ€™ll take will be forever treasured.

title: Nice tour on a Rainy Day
text: The self-guided audio tour was informative and interesting. I would allow 2-3 hours to fully tour the residence and grounds. Not many staff members are available to assist visitors and the signage for directions can be confusing throughout the residence...

title: Lo mas bonito el Antiquarium
text: En primer lugar, la entrada muy mal seÃ±alizada! Se entra justo por la parte de atrÃ¡s de la puerta principal. Cogimos la entrada general de 7 â‚¬. La visita es bastante monÃ³tona. Habitaciones con mucho lujo, cuadros, poca historia, lo Ãºnico que me impresionÃ³ es el AntiquÃ¡rium (que estÃ¡ al principio de la visita), el resto prescindible. Se pueden hacer fotos y dan audioguÃ­as gratis.

title: Sublime
text: BÃ¢timent magnifique avec niveau exceptionnel de prÃ©servation ! Incroyable de richesses et de diversitÃ© !
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Outstanding cultural display.
text: The residence was the home of the family that ruled Bavaria for close to 800 years. Although parts were heavily damaged during WWII, the restoration work is of the highest quality. Outstanding displays of precious objects in the Schatzkammer (treasury). A seemingly endless number of rooms featuring furniture, household objects such as dinner ware, and beautiful tapestries.

title: Great museum
text: We waited for a rainy day and did the Munich Residence museum.  It was crowded, but not a problem getting around.  Very interesting and worth the couple of hours spent.

title: Nice
text: Located in the heart of the city, the Residence lures you from afar with its appealing architecture, wonderful lighting, superb ambience et al.

title: Impressive old palace
text: The audio tour was very helpful and comprehensive. The palace is huge, allow at least a couple of hours to see it properly. Photography is allowed, but flash photos aren't, and there are many attendants throughout the palace to enforce this.

title: So viel Prunk...
text: Es ist schon erstaunlich, was die FÃ¼rsten der frÃ¼heren Zeit alles von ihrem Volk haben erarbeiten lassen, diese ReichtÃ¼mer sind schon sehenswert. Doch man muss schon etwas Zeit mitbringen um all diese SchÃ¶nheiten und auch ScheuÃŸlichkeiten gebÃ¼hrend zu bewundern.

title: Very Interesting, But Not Quick
text: This is a very impressive building in which you go through over 130 rooms.  Plan on being in the residence for at least two hours.  If you listen to the audio guide in each room, you will be there all day.The treasury museum there is a separate charge.  It is worth it. The theater for opera is yet another charge.  It is NOT worth the time nor money.

title: 5 stars for Treasury 3 stars for the rest
text: The treasury section is small, but very cool with some significant medieval historical context. The rest of the structure was almost bombed flat during WWII (like much of Munich). After the first half-dozen rooms where each description (both text and audio available in English) has a coda of "reconstructed based on period piece designs..," you start getting a bit jaded. This is particularly true since most the of rooms are empty or partially furnished with items that were not there originally. It's a sad commentary on the enormous cultural cost of war that's often ignored behind the cost in lives, economic stability, etc. Take the short tour route and save energy for other attractions.

title: Lovely area with nice park
text: Went past this building on our way to the English Gardens, it's very nice and has a lovely park attached to it where a man was playing classical music with a cello. The park itself was filled with pretty and colourful flowers.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: The grandest palace
text: The beauty of visiting this beautiful museum is to go after 4pm as there were very few people wandering inside the museum. When I walked to the Antiquarium, I was the only visitor except one staff member was there. It was pretty amazing. It would be even better if it was a bit brighter as there was only nature night from the window. I donâ€™t know whether they ever had lights on. My favourites were the Antiquarium, Kingâ€™s Tract, Ornate Rooms, Green Gallery, Stone Rooms and Ancestral Gallery. Going so late also meant I missed the theatre, as I didn't have enough time to see everything.

title: Spectacular grandeur
text: I took the combined ticket with the treasury and the CuvilleTheatre. This is a large palace You can spend 3 hrs to go from room to room You need the audio guide to go through as it also covers few centuries of history until the modern It is restored to mint condition. I saw downstairs the most impressive collection of treasury I ever see. The china and porcelain figure dating from the mid 15 century The audio guide explains some of the scene as some of the pieces are quite elaborate The tapestry the display of furniture the Grune Room which was my fav The staff is very helpful Count at least 3 hrs if you include the Theatre You are also very close to shopping area for lunch Highly recommended

Pour nous c'Ã©tait trop ! (5 fois le petit cabinet, 5 fois la chambre, 5 fois...Il faut sÃ»re ment se restreindre si on veut vraiment profiter.

title: Incantevole
text: Questa residenza Ã¨ veramente enorme e piena di stanze bellissime. All'ingresso Ã¨ possibile prendere una audioguida (anche in lingua italiana) che descrive diverse cose in ogni stanza selezionando il relativo numero.

title: Sehr Gut
text: Den kongelige residensen er absolutt verdt ett besÃ¸k! Her er det mye spennende historie Ã¥ fÃ¥ med seg. Mange av rommene er veldige flotte. Anbefales!

title: Beautiful palace with tons of history!
text: There is so much to see, I recommend purchasing the all â‚¬13 ticket so you can see the theater, treasurery, and museum. It is full of amazing sculptures, paintings, tapestries, silver, gold, everything a king would have. All of the artifacts have been well cared for and preserved. Make sure you wear some comfortable walking shoes.

title: Interesting
text: great building with some great stories, the art is wonderful and we could have walked through twice. very expansive

title: Amazing
text: We decided to give our livers a rest from Oktoberfest and visted here and wow, it doesn't fail in the spectacular factor. We did the combined treasury and palace ticket. The treasury was good but that was more exhibits on display where as the palace is/was a living museum, fantastic. So much decedance and it's huge. We'd spent 3 hours there when we stumbled across another part when we assumed we were heading to the exit. Busy but not overcrowded and well worth getting the audio guide and arrows around the place at least giving some sort of direction in which best way to see all. Can't remember now if you're allowed but if so take a bottle of water around with you. It has a good mixture of everything from statues, paintings, tapestries to wholly furnished rooms with good history guides in each room. Highly recommended. And so easy to get to wherever you are in Munich.

title: a stunning example of opulance
text: A person could spend all day exploring this place.  Paintings, woodwork, furniture and a heck of a greek and roman sculpture collection.

title: RegalitÃ  allo stato puro.
text: Da vedere e gustare. Stanze magnifiche, arredi storici ( peccato che a causa della guerra molti sono stati ricostruiti), soffitti e lampadari meravigliosi.Da vedere
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: GRANDEUR
text: This is a great place to visit.  Huge!  OK, it isn't on the same scale as Versailles but it is pretty great.  We were there in early Sept. and found few visitors.  Very enjoyable and easy get there by walking from Marienplatz.

title: So many tapestries!
text: It was great the first couple rooms! Then it was the same thing over and over again: tapestries, paintings, furniture. It was all interesting, but it was spread out in room after room after room of the same three things.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Rococo Ã  souhait
text: Nous on aime, superbe rÃ©sidence impÃ©riale, un must go and see Ã  MÃ¼nich. Dommage que nous ayons d'abord ratÃ© les heures d'ouvertures. Le jardin est maniÃ¨re avec ses satyres, mais l'intÃ©rieur est une merveille qui vaut largement Versailles. Les bijjoux seraient Ã©videmment mieux dans mon salon et la couronne impÃ©rale sur ma tÃªte, mais il paraÃ®t que rien n'est prÃªtÃ©.

title: Allow 3 hours
text: This place is huge. Buy the combined ticket to see the treasury, museum and palace.   We started in the treasury at 1.30pm and used the free audio guides.  The jewels were magnificent,  and we spent close to an hour there.  If you listen to everything in the treasury,  it takes 5 hours! We then went into the museum,  took the long tour with our audio guides. Probably another 1.5 hours and only listening to the ones we were interested in.   Last was the palace and we rushed through,  probably only 20 minutes.  Allow a good 3 hours,  much more if you want to listen to everything. We loved it and was a highlight of our visit to Munich. I thought our ticket included the theatre but it didn't.  It's located outside and around the back. I chose to pay to go in  (2.50  euro)                  but probably didn't need to.  Look at the photos online,  that's all  you'll see.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Great plush palace with interesting architecture
text: Great plush palace with interesting architecture, great halls and over the top furnishings, we didnâ€™t do the whole tour but was really nice, worth a visit and in the center of Munich.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Splediferous!
text: What a place. We spent 3 hours in this building and the treasury, and it wasn't long enough.Absoloutely beautiful building, packed with things to see, a must to go to.

title: Wonderful site. A must.
text: We had a great visit here. We spent three hours. The walking is easy. There are few stairs, if that is an issue. The audio guide is easy to use and very informative. We went on a Saturday afternoon and it wasnâ€™t crowded. Kids probably wonâ€™t like it. It is close to nice eateries. There are plenty of restrooms that are conveniently situated. Seven euros per person plus extra fees if you want an audio guide or a real guide. You can bring in your own water bottle too.

title: Astounding!!
text: A fantastic palace/museum that is a must do in Munich! Allow plently of time, it is huge! Don't forget to see the theatre and tresurty - you can get a combination ticket for all 3.

title: Molto grande!
text: Enorme struttura, a tratti quasi dispersiva. Per visitarla ci vogliono quasi 3 ore, di piÃ¹ se si prende lâ€™audioguida. Sale riccamente decorate. Unica nota negativa: ci abbiamo messo un poâ€™ prima di trovare lâ€™entrata, dei cartelli sarebbero stati utili. E inoltre a volte allâ€™interno i percorsi erano poco chiari e dovevi tornare indietro per proseguire. A parte questo, assolutamente da visitare!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Visit to The Residenz in Munich
text: We ttoured the treasury in which crown jewels were on display.  The most interesting pieces were the medieval crowns of female consorts.  We also toured the royal apartments, which proved iworthwhile.  Audio guides were available in many languages, and  you do a self-tour.  Visiting the Residenz is a good choice during inclement weather.

title: Amazing palace
text: Munich residence was the seat of government and Bavarian dukes and it expanded too big during last centuries. It's an amazing palace and one of the most attractive items in Munich.

title: Huge and magnificent
text: This building is really very impressive, fantastic rooms, it's definitely worth a visit if you are nearby

title: Amazing museum...must visit!
text: This museum is a must visit site in Munich.130 + rooms of history and wonderful decor.Well presented exhibitions

title: The antiquarium is beautiful
text: We spent 2 hours and it was quite rushed. Many beautiful rooms with opulent interior furnishings and architecture and history to cover. Most impressive is the hall Antiquarium with the painted decorative arches hoovering over the ceiling.
