title: Blew us away
text: We didnâ€™t even plan to come here - just happened upon it and are SO glad we spent a few hours exploring the rooms! Truly some of the most stunning examples of baroque architecture in Europe. Definitely use the audio guide, itâ€™s excellent!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Museum of kings of Bavaria
text: The Residenz in central munich served as the seat of government and residence of the dukes and kings of bavaria from 1508 to 1918. The former royal palace is now a museum. Its rooms and collections cover the period from the Renaissance to the Neoclassicism.

title: Such a great place
text: A great historical place which was damaged during the war. Very big and you need about 3 hours or bit more to visit all the rooms of the residence and the museum. The rooms are amazing and worth spending hours listening to all the details provided in the audio device which is included with the ticket price. The museum is not very big but it contains many amazing jewelery and other stuff. I really enjoyed my visit and would love to visit it again.

title: Spectacular
text: The artistry is amazing.  Nothing like I've seen before in the Unites States.  The intricacy of designs is truly amazing.  Everything is breathtaking.

title: Antiquarium
text: I visited the Munich Residence in August 2019.  It is a spectacular place.  I bought a combo ticket for 11 euros for the Treasury and the Residenz Museum.  The Treasury is full of artifacts and should take 30 to 45 minutes to go through.  There were crowns, items related to Saint George and many other things.  The Residenz Museum is endless.  The Grottos were very interesting.  And then the Antiquarium.  What an unbelievable place.  I had to go back in and look at it a second time.  The rest of the Residenz Musuem is full of rooms that go on forever.  There are many paintings, tapestries.  Some rooms were closed.  I spent around 90 minutes there.  If you are in a hurry then the key is the Antiquarium and the Grottos.  The Munich Residence is a must-see on any visit to Munich.

title: Residenza lussuosa
text: Un edificio sorprendente e lussuoso con meravigliose decorazioni e dipinti. Si trova vicino ai giardini inglesi. Imperdibile.

title: Oktoberfest 2019
text: BarÃ¡ti kirÃ¡ndulÃ¡son voltunk MÃ¼nchenben, Ã©s a mÃºzeumot is felkerestÃ¼k. AbszolÃºt megÃ©rte, hatalmas Ã©s gyÃ¶nyÃ¶rÅ±, lÃ¡tni kell.

title: Stunning Palace in the centre of Munich
text: Loved this palace, full of history and is beautifully decorated. Has many paintings and even all the silverware the Royals used when they had guests.Takes a while to get round (140 rooms) but for only 7 Euro had no complaints and well worth the visit.

title: Very impressive
text: A gorgeous display of history, beautifully presented.  Staff were helpful as was the personal audio guide.Plan to spend 3-5 hours here, it's well worth taking your time and reaching every room and corner of the place.  Stunning.

title: Wow - Lots to See!
text: The Munich Residence is worth seeing - we spent approximately 3 hours inside.  So much to see, very interesting, beautiful, and worth the time to see.

title: Impressive
text: In the heart of Munich so don't pass on your shopping trip without visiting the Residenz. Careful, you could spend days in there!

title: Very nice, but somewhat disorganized
text: We found it very hard to find the entrance - took awhile to find a sign for it. I think we would have have found this more interesting had we used the audio guide - our mistake. As it was, the signage was very difficult to follow and we ended up just wandering from room to room. The rooms are beautiful in themselves, but I would definitely suggest using the the audio guide to get the full experience - from what I gather, it makes a big difference.

title: More beautiful than Versailles
text: Take a still through the longest running monarchy in the world. Bavarian art and beautiful preservation of the time period. Makes you wanna be a king. See when you go to Marienplatz
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Awe inspiring
text: Munich Residence is a deceptive name for this palace. Think Versailles in Germany. The Antiquarium and Grune Gallery alone are worth the price of admission but there is so much more to see. Wear comfortable shoes and allow several hours in order to do it justice. They offer combination tickets for palace and treasury or palace, treasury and theater.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Palazzo reale
text: Dicono sia il piÃ¹ grande dâ€™Europa. Di certo la visita Ã¨ infinita. Audioguida esaustiva in italiano. Stancante ma assolutamente da non perdere.

title: Beautiful
text: We had a private dinner there and the staff was excellent, they even did a singing performance for us.

title: Ist einen Besuch allemal wert
text: Wir waren mit Familie in der Residenz. Einfach nur toll wenn man bedenkt, dass das ganze GebÃ¤ude nahezu komplett im Krieg zerstÃ¶rt war. Wir waren sehr begeistert von dem tollen Ambiente.

title: Amazing place
text: We purchased the 3 in one ticket to cover the residence, treasury and theater. We literally spent 5 hours there, and could have spent more time. You get a narrated guided tour in your language, which is very good - detailed and explicit. I would highly recommend visiting.

title: Lindo, mas imenso
text: O Residenz Ã© maravilhoso por dentro. Mas aconselho nÃ£o esgota-lo porque Ã© imenso e acaba ficando repetitivo. O audio-guia estÃ¡ incluso no valor da entrada (7â‚¬).
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: PalÃ¡cio maravilhoso!
text: Esse palÃ¡cio me surpreendeu por sua arquitetura, tamanho, conservaÃ§Ã£o. Os portais sÃ£o incriveis. HÃ¡ decoraÃ§Ãµes muito interessante. A visita Ã© bem estruturada. Muiiito organizado. Ã‰ enorme. VÃ¡ com tempo. Eu ficaria umas 4 horas.

title: Well reconstructed.
text: Unfortunately almost all buildings of Residence destroyed in WWII. Everything we can see now well reconstructed buildings. Furniture from XIX Centuries. Too many rooms with no significant value.

title: Massive!  Oppulent!  Overwhelming!
text: A must see in Munich, very close to Marienplatz.  I had visited the Residence a few years ago, but did not remember so many rooms and exhibits on display of the Wittelsbach dynasty.  This was a simply extraordinary exhibition.  There is also a gift shop associated with the venue that is quite good as well.

title: What else to do on a rainy day?
text: The sheer scale of the Residenz was amazing. It reminded us very much of a recent visit to the Hermitage with displays of opulence and over-the-top decor. Of the 130 rooms available to visit we probably managed about half before becoming rather bemused. Nevertheless, we were very impressed with the high standard of restoration and presentation of artefacts. A combined ticket gave us access to the Residenzmuseum and Treasury which at â‚¬9 each (for those of a certain age) was excellent value. A great way to spend a very wet day!

title: Well worth the 7e entry fee
text: Entry fee includes free audio guide which you enter number displayed in room if you want to know more. Fantastic displays of furniture, porcelain silverware and paintings. It was raining so we killed a morning in here. Lots of walking and stairs. Allow 3hrs for a good look round. Amazing rooms.

title: Great place
text: The palace was huge darn near 100 rooms on the full tourWe had no idea it was so large make sure to are in shape with comfortable shoes

text: What an astonishing expierience. Audio guide was helpful. We loved it. Lots of details about the royal family and how they uses to live!

title: nice
text: Its a post world war restoration... Unbelievable art work. Please interested in history would really love to be here. place is close to marienplatz.. That is city center with other tourist places close by

title: 3 Lazy Hours
text: Our family had some time to share in Old Munich Town before lunch at the Beer House and off to the airport home.The self guided tour of Munich Residence was very informative however half way through it became much the same royal rooms over and over and the directional path was unforgiving. You can't take a short cut if bored. The guides make you continue through ho hum...Couldn't wait to get to the Beer House.

title: Da Norimberga a Monaco.
text: Facilmente raggiungibile a piedi da Marienplatz. Lussuoso palazzo visitabile al suo interno con audio guida inclusa nel prezzo del biglietto. Sicuramente una tappa che merita attenzione e da dedicare un paio di ore.Saluti Gaetano e Cinzia
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Wonderful
text: Fantastici luoghi da visitare con calma e senza fretta... Interessante e meraviglioso luogo incantevole di grande valenza storica. Ci tornerÃ² per visitarlo piÃ¹ a fondo... Impossibile farlo solo in una giornata.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Beeindruckend
text: Eine der wichtigsten Orte auf der To Do Liste in MÃ¼nchen. Sehr beeindruckende RÃ¤ume, unter anderem ein faszinierender Speisesaal der sehr gut erhalten ist.

title: Beautiful place, impressive renovation
text: The Munich residence was a really beautiful place, such a shame that the original building was almost completely destroyed by bombing, but impressive renovation work has happened, giving the building a feel of it being in it's prime again. The only thing that could be improved is the audio guides, which is very heavy in historic information, so can drone on a bit with the amount of clips during the visit, also having earphones for them would be preferable.

title: Very large and a bit confusing to navigate
text: This place is HUGE, you need hours to go through it all.  We got the audio guide and only managed 1/2 of the residence.  We also had to wait for an audio guide as they were all given out.  There are a bunch of rooms to see, and the way isn't very clearly marked on how to go about it, quite a few we had to backtrack.

title: Warte zobaczenia
text: Sporo chodzenia po piÄ™knych wnÄ™trzach. WraÅ¼enie robiÄ… relikwie!! Conajmniej pÃ³Å‚torej godziny. W Å›rodku bardzo ciepÅ‚o wiÄ™c lepiej wybraÄ‡ siÄ™ w chÅ‚odny dzieÅ„
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Lugar de obligada visita en tu paso por Munich
text: La residencia es un museo que hay que visitar en Munich pero eso sÃ­ hay que ir con tiempo ya que es enorme con muchas salas que ver y yo recomendarÃ­a ir con guÃ­a por quÃ© los audioguias aunque estÃ¡n muy bien puedes estar horas dentro. Muy bonito.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Very good and a must see
text: This palace takes a long time to see. Its a bit of a rabbit warren across 130 rooms and several levels so you need to pay careful attention to the direction arrows. The audio tour is included in the price but if you listened to every station you would be there for a week!Its a wonderfully ornate palace and quite overwhelming both in terms of history and art. A fabulous porcelain collection and an interesting reliquary room. If you like gilt, this is the palace for you!

title: Palazzo di una bellezza rara
text: Ho visitato questo Palazzo stupendomi ad ogni sala della magnificenza di ogni oggetto. Con l'aiuto dell'audioguida mi sono immersa nella storia ed ho potuto godere appieno di ogni singola parola. Visita per nulla noiosa e che tutti dovrebbero a mio avviso fare. Le sale sono tutte ben tenute e controllate dal personale. In certe sale purtroppo abbiamo patito un pochino il caldo ma ne Ã¨ valsa la pena.

title: Spettacolare
text: Prendetevi un pomeriggio intero per visitare la residenza invernale, perchÃ© il numero di stanze da vedere Ã¨ notevole.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Da rimanere senza fiato
text: PiÃ¹ di 70 stanze oltre alla sala riunioni che Ã¨ indescrivibile.Un palazzo perfettamente ricreato dopo la seconda guerra mondiale.7 euro per entrare con guida audio. Ci vogliono almeno 2 ore per visitarlo attentamente.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Looks better in pictures
text: There are some attractions that look better in pictures. Munich Residence is one of them. It's not bad, but there are more beautiful palaces in Bavaria for sure.

title: Enormous and beautiful
text: I thought we would spend a few hours but spent the better part of the day.  The complex is very large and beautiful.  It is well worth the time to wander thru it.

title: NO PUEDE PERDERSE
text: Esta impresionante Residencia, cuya construcciÃ³n se iniciÃ³ en el siglo XIV y ha sido residencia de los Reyes BÃ¡varos. Su visita es obligada ya que alberga dependencias dignas de admirar como pueden ser La Gruta de las almejas, el Antiquarium que es una sala de estilo renacentista que te impacta, las numerosas habitaciones a cual mÃ¡s espectacular y sin duda alguna la Sala de Tesoros y el Teatro de CuvilliÃ©s.Tiempo aproximada de visita: 4 horas.FotografÃ­as: Si.Entrada: Si, pero con la tarjeta turÃ­stica es mÃ¡s barata.

title: Tanto la residenza tanto la famiglia
text: Troppo spesso l'intricata storia europea ci fa perdere la sensazione dell'importanza di un regno  o di una famiglia regnate. Questa residenza, con la sua maestositÃ  e grazie anche alle continue integrazioni architettoniche, ci fa rivivere qualche secolo di grandioso e sfarzoso modo di vivere. Ottime le audioguide che consentono una narrazione interessante e avvincente durante tutta la visita. Assolutamente da non perdere il tesoro, superfluo il teatro.

title: The residenz
text: Bellissima maestosa e spettacolare. Assoluta mente da vedere. Audioguida fornisce tutti i particolari. Con il biglietto si puo scegliere di vedere anche il piccolo Teatro. Ãˆ un gioiellino ma secondo me non vale la pena. Invece imperdibili le stanze della residenza.

title: Monipuolinen museo
text: Museossa on kalustettuja huoneita, patsaita, gobeliineja. Tulee mieleen Pietarin Eremitaasi. LisÃ¤ksi erillisessÃ¤ nÃ¤yttelyssÃ¤ kirkollisia esineitÃ¤, kruunuja, koruja, arkisempiakin esineitÃ¤. Saimme kulumaan siellÃ¤ kolme tuntia sillÃ¤ katsomista oli niin paljon.Suosittelen.

title: Bella!
text: La mia recensione si riferisce solo all'esterno della struttura, poichÃ© per problemi di tempo limitato, non ho potuto visitarla.Senz'altro ha un apparenza scenografica e molto fotogenica!

title: Immense
text: Visite Ã  ne pas manquer en Ã©tant sur Munich. Nous y avons passÃ© 4 heures en tout qui sont passÃ©es trÃ¨s vite grace aux audioguides. On peut avoir par moment lâ€™impression dâ€™Ãªtre perdu car le cheminement nâ€™est pas toujours Ã©vident. Ne pas rater le trÃ©sor qui contient des piÃ¨ces assez incroyables

title: Unorganized
text: While it may be large, ornate and lavish, the museum is not welcoming to visitors.Save your money and sneak inside the Opera House instead!

title: Bavarian history
text: The Residence is huge, there are a lot of rooms to visit and collections to admire. Itâ€™s intresting to find more about the Bavarian history. Once you get in the Odeonsplatz form the U, you will have to walk a bit in front, the entrance is not very good signaled ğŸ˜•Also the stuff is very, very rude and they bearly speak english. Too bad!!!

title: Well worth the entrance fee
text: Hadnt planned to visit here but very glad we did.We hadnt imagined it was so huge.I think 103 rooms.Loads to see.You are guided around by arrows & need about 2-3 hours.Only downside was that we queued in pouring rain around 25mins to get in & on reaching the ticket desk the cashier was extremely rude.He is obviously someone who shouldnt be working with the public.This was in contrast to the lovely helpful lady in the well stocked shop.

title: Must see in Munich
text: This impressive museum with lots of history and countless room is naturally a must see in Munich. You can always debate if it is you stile and if you have seen old fashion enough in your life but surely it is impressive and the room decorated with all the shells is not something you see every day

title: Awesome Treasury Museum
text: We only had time to visit the treasury, but we would love to return to see the rest of the museum.We spent about two hours just in the treasury.  The audio guide is very good.  Also, we believe the jewels on display were much more interesting than the jewels in the Hofburg.  If you have any interest in history, then I believe you will definitely enjoy the experience.

title: Great musium
text: Is so huge you need like 3 hours to explor and donâ€™t forget to take the gude because you will need it

title: TrÃ¨s beau monument et un trÃ©sor simplement fantastique
text: Nous conseillons vivement la visite de ce monument. De grandes salles aux diffÃ©rentes Ã©poques de lâ€™histoire de la rÃ©gion et un trÃ©sor exceptionnel par la beautÃ© des piÃ¨ces prÃ©sentÃ©es.Vraiment Ã  faire !
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Lots to see
text: We bought the ticket for Residenz, Treasury and Cuilvee Theatre and it was well worth it.Loads to see and you will need at least 3 hours to see it all and a lot of walking. It was bombed during WWII so some magnificent restoration has been needed over the decades with more to do. Get an audio guide as labelling is limited and the guide books in the shop are in German.Fascinating morning and early afternoon was had.

title: Por fuera es imponente
text: No es precisamente bello, al menos no en toda su extensiÃ³n, pero es autÃ©nticamente enorme. Tiene el interÃ©s que fue la residencia de los reyes de Baviera y aunque no pudimos entrar por falta de tiempo se ve que es muy recomendable su visita.

title: Stupenda...
text: ....immensa, 140 stanze, forse un poâ€™ troppe da visitare con i bimbi, ma forse anche da soli. Per fortuna ci sono le audioguide ed un percorso abbreviato. In ogni caso ne ve la pena!!!! ğŸ”

title: Favolosa residenza!
text: Una visita bellissima. Veramente interessante. Da non perdere per la ricchezza degli interni. Utilissimo lâ€™utilizzo dellâ€™audioguida fornito allâ€™ingresso.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Mejor por dentro
text: Aunque por fuera el edificio no es precisamente muy llamativo, por dentro es un palacio que merece visitarse.

title: Bello, da vedere
text: Palazzo enorme. Belle stanze. Audio guida buona (anche se fornisce la descrizione delle stanze in maniera didascalica e non fornisce curiosita' o descrizioni interessanti)Come altri monumenti a monaco le descrizioni dei percorsi non ci sono o non sono chiare (impossibile trovare l'entrata del museo se provieni dalla direzione opposta).Se si va a Monaco Ã¨ una tappa d'obbligo (vista l'estensione e l'imponenza del palazzo).

title: Un bel palazzo
text: Il palazzo si trova all'interno di Monaco. Ãˆ composto da tre parti: il palazzo, il museo degli oggetti in oro e il teatro. I primi due si visitano con un'audioguida da non usarla completamente se non si vuole passare un'intera giornata al palazzo. Si visitano tante stanze tra le quali la stanza del trono. Se si vuole visitare piÃ¹ di due castelli bavaresi, conviene comprare l'abbonamento che costa 26 euro.

title: Residenz
text: Da visitare assolutamente Il palazzo Ã¨ veramente enorme con tantissime stanze da vedere (2/3 ore) Biglietto cumulativo con Teatro e Tesoro 13â‚¬ - gratis per under18 Audioguida compresa nel prezzo Obbligatorio lasciare borse e zaini al guardaroba

title: Visita obligatoria en MunichÂ¡Â¡Â¡
text: La Residencia de MÃºnich fue un palacio perteneciente a los Reyes de Baviera, el mas grande de Alemania.Situado en la Odeonplazt,en el centro histÃ³rico de la ciudadContiene 10 patios y 130 habitaciones donde albergan una importantÃ­sima cantidad de obras de arte,joyas,antiguedades ect.Es una de las visitas obligatorias en MÃºnich,y si recomiendo disponer de tiempo suficiente para poder visitarlo porque dispone de muchas salas y son necesarias varias horas

title: Lovely and Huge!
text: I went with my 3 teenaged sons for a couple of hours.  The palace goes on and on so we had to leave before seeing it all.  It was quite beautiful and ornate. It was interesting to see the how the decor differed throughout based on time periods.  Lots to look at!  We went a little later in the day so there were not a lot of people which was very  nice since it was warm inside.  However, because we were there later, we were not able to view the Treasury.  If you have a student I.D., take it with you to enjoy a discount.  Worthwhile visit!

title: Amazing palace
text: Unbelievable. Stunning. Amazing! I couldnâ€™t believe it wasnâ€™t busier on a Saturday afternoon. Do not miss the treasury. Itâ€™s definitely worth it!

title: Opulenta e monumentale
text: Dalla visita che - preparatevi - vi prenderÃ  almeno 3 ore intensive, risulta evidente il leit motiv dei reggenti bavaresi, la megalomania e l'esercizio spasmodico del potere, reso manifesto dalla maestositÃ  di una residenza monachese accresciuta ad ogni nuovo insediamento. Ciascuno ha aggiunto parti sempre piÃ¹ ricche, sino a giungere ad una struttura enorme, quasi dispersiva, bellissima. Vi stancherete al punto che alla visita delle ultime 60 stanze avrete dimenticato le precedenti 60. Se vi lascerete portare dalla guida gratuita in varie lingue, i tempi si allungano vertiginosamente. Ogni stanza prevede una spiegazione di almeno 5 minuti. Potrete visitare il tesoro (da vedere  assolutamente) con un biglietto a parte ed il teatro li vicino (si fa per dire). Potrete acquistare il biglietto complessivo a 13 euro. Sicuramente da fare.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Residence of residences
text: Floors and rooms of ornate and truly beautiful royal historical treasures.   Give yourself plenty of time to take in the adventure.  The teens loved the Munich Residenz also.  Make time to take in all the beautiful treasures of the past.

title: Una visita interessante
text: Avendo poco tempo a disposizione abbiamo scelto di visitare questo palazzo ubicato nel centro cittÃ . La struttura Ã¨ imponente e nonostante i danni subiti durante la guerra Ã¨ stata oggetto di attenta  ristrutturazione. Senz'altro una visita istruttiva sulla storia della casa regnante di Baviera. Particolarmente interessante l'Antiquarium. Non ci siamo pentiti della scelta.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Groots en uniek
text: Een combinatieticket residenz,schatkamer en theater is de beste koop. Jammer net onze dag was het grote schoonmaak in het cuvillier theater. De residenz is prachtig, reken ruim 2,5 uur voor dit prachtig paleis.Neem,dan een pauze bv lunch en bezoek nadien schatkamer, theater en de tuin.Reken toch zeker vier uur als je dit wil ervaren. De audioguide is gratis .

title: Sehenswert
text: Die Residenz gehÃ¶rt fÃ¼r mich zu den SehenswÃ¼rdigkeiten, die zum Pflichtprogramm eines MÃ¼nchen-Aufenthals gehÃ¶ren.

text: If you like history - touring this is a must!   Lots of artifacts, and the rooms are magnificent.  Could be a really long tour so bring water!

title: Sottovalutata!
text: La visita alla Residenza  Ã¨ stata un'autentica rivelazione. Ben organizzato il percorso attraverso 70 ambienti di vario genere (alcuni veramente  spettacolari) maggiormente apprezzabili con l'ausilio di audioguida ricca di approfondite spiegazioni in italiano (compresa nel prezzo del biglietto â‚¬7). Durata circa 2 ore.

title: Massive hence great value
text: You could spend your day in here, well well worth the entry fee! Top tips for maximising your visit:Take water. There is none available and the tour is loooooong. Go to the toilet first. Loos are few and far between.Listen to the audio guide only for each Hall. There are entries for every room and specific items in them, donâ€™t bother. Each corridor has a sufficiently detailed overview usually ending 00 on the guide (100,200,300 etc. Ignore 110, 120, 130 etc)Get your German for â€œexcuse meâ€ â€œEXCUSE MEâ€ and â€œMOVE!â€ ready (or more likely your Mandarin) Some people have no awareness of their surroundings and the spaces can be tight. If you donâ€™t see this going on itâ€™s you, get out of the way!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Buiten de officiele schatkamer, nog 130 kamers vol kunstschatten. Meer dan inrukwekkend.
text: Je kunt hier een hele dag dwalen door de meer dan 130 (?) kamers en zalen met kunstschatten. Het geeft een overweldigend beeld van de ongekende rijkdom en status van de koningen van Beieren en de eeuwenlange geschiedenis van het koningshuis. Daarna (of als eerste..) nog een bezoek aan de grote schatkamer met juwelen en andere kostbaarheden en een bezoek aan het prachtige paleis-theater. Neem er een hele dag de tijd voor en ga daarna met de voeten omhoog ergens uitrusten in de tuin achter het paleis, met op de achtergrond een muziekje van Ã©Ã©n van de vele straatmuzikanten.

title: A faire vraiment
text: Si vous n avez qu une chose Ã  faire c est la Residenz ! L audio guide aide Ã  suivre la vie de la plus riche famille bavaroise de l epoque avec trÃ©sors Ã  gogo !Allez y les yeux ouverts !

title: Super but takes a lot of your time.
text: The museum is fabulous and very worth visiting. You have to have at least 3 hours to get a quick look at everything. Price is just fine. Advice; buy the combination ticket!

title: Magnificent, in a huge palace
text: If we decide to visit the Residenz, let's be ready to enjoy more than a hundred rooms-halls-corridors (we're said that they are about 140!). Well, is all this too much perhaps? Can we be concentrated for such a long time? Honestly speaking, I haven't been able to... even if I used the audioguides in my native language. Maybe a good solution could be this: we buy the ticket and we can use it in two different days.

title: Meravigliosa
text: Visita con due bimbe di 5 e 7 anni. Abbiamo preso le audioguide (gratuite). La residenza Ã¨ spettacolare. Anche alle bimbe Ã¨ piaciuta moltissimo. Il biglietto cumulativo con tesoro e teatro curvilineo molto utile. Da vedere

title: Lovely concert with dinner.
text: Through Classictic.com, we reserved tickets for a performance at the Munich Residenz. It was a 3-piece ensemble that played Bach and Vivaldi. The setting was a chapel in the residence, and the concert did not disappoint. Afterwards, we enjoyed a traditional Bavarian dinner as part of our package. We also toured the Residence. Try a concert as part of your trip â€” we have never been disappointed.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Bellissima visita
text: Proprio bellissima la nostra visita alla Residenz di Monaco, luogo pieno di storia e di capolavori.Vi consiglio il tour completo che consiste negli appartamenti reali completi, nel ricco tesoro e nello splendido teatro rococÃ².Molto completa Ã¨ anche l'audioguida in varie lingue e molto cortese il personale che cerca sempre di agevolare il visitatore. Ãˆ possibile interrompere il giro  consegnare l'audioguida, uscire per il pranzo e ricominciare il tutto nel pomeriggio. Ottima visita in un bellissimo posto.

title: My favourite place in Munich
text: What a beautiful and magical place - well located in the heart of the city centre. Tickets allow you to come back and visit again so, no need to rush. Try and visit in different days and take all the history in - It's amazing!! Don't leave town without visiting this place. Highly recommended!

title: souper royal
text: La visite commence par ce lieu incroyable ou le roi soupait sur une estrade devant les privilÃ©giÃ©s de la cour et ils pouvaient Ãªtre nombreux car, eux, ils Ã©taient debout.De magnifiques Deruta ouvrent le bal de cette salle ornÃ©e de chaque cÃ´tÃ© d'imposantes statues de bustes romain. Il faut, avant de la quitter pour continuer la visite, prendre la peine de se retourner...Le spectacle est saisissant.La fontaine Baroque ornÃ©e de coquillage est un modÃ¨le du genrePar manque de temps nous n'avons fait que la visite courte qui Ã  la sortie nous a permis de voir la galerie  des ancÃªtres  Ã©rigÃ©e au XVII Ã¨me ainsi que l'arbre gÃ©nÃ©alogique particuliÃ¨rement impressionnant....

title: Munich Residenz de moeite waard maar erg veel.
text: We hebben de munich residenz bezocht. Een erom groot kasteel midden in de stad. Elke heerser bouwde zijn eigen gedeelte eraan. Het kasteel is erg groot en op een bepaald moment is het ook genoeg. Jammer dat ze niet meer de spot zetten op een aantal high lights. Maar het is zeker de moeite waard dit op te nemen in je programma.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Visite riche
text: Beaucoup de choses Ã  voir dans ce musÃ©e immense. Bien choisir ses centres d'intÃ©rÃªt avant de commencer la visite, on ne peut pas tout voir. Un bÃ©mol :avec les travaux dans certaines salles le plan est un peu difficile Ã  suivre !
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Mooi om even rond te lopen
text: Ik vond het mooi om even in de Residence rond te lopen, maar was er wel snel op uitgekeken. Als je in de buurt bent ff doen, maar thatâ€™s it.

title: A huge palace
text: A scenic site good for photo-taking, history learning, cultural impact and so on. Plenty of time must be reserved to walk through, otherwise, simply focus on the grand hall and concert hall.

title: Belle visite
text: La visite est intÃ©ressante quoiqu un peu longue avec l audio guide. Le personnel est sympathique et certains parlent anglais parfois franÃ§ais. Les salles sont trÃ¨s nombreuses il faut prÃ©voir une demie journÃ©e.

title: Ein Muss - als Museumsbesuch
text: Sehr schÃ¶n und umfangreich! Man wird in die alte Zeit zurÃ¼ckversetzt und kann den Prunk bestaunen!  Ein ganz tolles Museum im Zentrum der Stadt!

title: Superves
text: Immense musÃ©e chÃ¢teau au centre de la ville offrant sur des kilomÃ¨tres de galeries de superbes collection de bijoux et objets.A voir .... Avec de bonne chaussures et 3 bonnes heures.

title: Excellant
text: Lots of rooms and walking but worth it ! So many rooms and lots of furniture . Treasury not as grand or wow as the Nymphenburg Palace . Beautiful tapestries !
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: My second favourite in Munich
text: After the nymphenburg, this is my favourite place in Munich. Such a rich collection of history and art you can find in very few other places (even if Dresden is better!!!). So, don't miss it.

title: EXCELENTE Y ENORME PALACIO
text: Es impresionante el edificio,las obras de arte que contiene y las salas  que alberga,hay que dedicarle mÃ­nimo de 3 a  4  horas.Recomendable  totalmente

title: Da non perdere
text: Visita davvero molto interessante.. Viene fornita gratuitamente una audioguida. Le sale della Rezidens sono davvero molto ben tenute e interessanti.. Prima di entrare gli zaini e le borse voluminose vengono lasciate anche queste gratuitamente al guardaroba.. Consigliato

title: Surprisingly Interesting
text: After several trips to Munich I finally decided to visit the Resdienz and enjoyed it and the Treasury. It's located in the center of town and easy to get to.

title: Must see peek into history
text: This palace has it all. Stately rooms with original furnishings and decorations, an indoor grotto, a grand hall with portraits and busts if the great from past centuries. You will enjoy it and can choose to hit the highlights or go in depth into history. We did a little if both and still had enough bandwidth to do a little shopping on the adjacent avenues

title: Maestosa
text: La residenz si trova proprio in centro e offre la possibilitÃ  di visitare stanze importanti dal punto di vista storico, bellissime e riccamente decorate. L'audioguida, compresa nel biglietto, accompagna con spiegazioni molto dettagliate tutte le stanze visitabili. Da non perdere.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Interesting
text: The interiors are beautiful and the history very interesting. We didnâ€™t book a tour and whilst you may learn more doing so, really donâ€™t need to. The entrance is easily found a short distance from Odeonsplatz and audio guides are provided. NOTE: ruck sacks etc are not allowed here and have to be left on pegs. We purchased the multi-ticket which includes the resident itself, treasury and theatre. This is good value although children / teens may start to get bored. The treasury was a pleasant surprise in terms of content and information and was well worth adding to the ticket. The only negative is as other reviews mention the directions are confusing in some areas but that doesnâ€™t spoil the visitor experience. Before or after the visit you can also view the field marshalsâ€™ hall.

title: Wunderbar!
text: Wonderful museum! Shows the luxurious life of the German kings. Well preserved. The staffs are nice. The direction is little bit confusing tho

title: Amazing
text: Lovely building with fabulous rooms with awesome intricate ceilings, art work and door ways and filled with wonderful artefacts.  The layout was strange and the directions around the palace was confusing.  The Treasury was fantastic, filled with beautiful and intricate artefacts, the craftsmanship of the exhibits was out of this world, amazing!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Bellissimo
text: Palazzo gigantesto, prendetevi un bel paio dâ€™ore per visitarlo tutto!Prezzo giusto (7â‚¬). Vi Ã¨ la possibilitÃ  di fare il biglietto per palazzo e teatro (11â‚¬).Molti membri del personale parlano italiano

title: Massive building with confusing directions inside
text: Right in the centre of Munich this building suffered badly in the Allied Bombing in 1944, but has been faithfully restored and a lot of the artifacts that could be removed were in safe keeping before the bombing and have since been returned. There are a selection of arrows directing you around but I found these to be confusing and not as easy to use as I had hoped often doubling back on myself.  Once in the area of porcelain collection things were even more confusing. It was difficult to find the way out. There is a free brochure showing the floor plan with numbered rooms, but I couldn't find these numbers displayed anywhere in the actual rooms. Had these been prominently displayed it would have made life so much easier for finding my way around. There is a lot to see and I spent around two hours here, but would have been a few minutes less if directions were better.

title: Impressive reconstruction
text: We visited with 3 teens. The Residence was largely reconstructed after the war and it seems about half the treasures (and most of the rooms) were reconstructions, so it lacked an authentic feel. Regardless, the reconstructed rooms were impressive and beautiful. It is a very big building - our daughters enjoyed it but our son got bored.  It wasnâ€™t crowded even though we visited in the middle of the day at the height of tourist season.

title: Beautiful from outside and inside
text: Magnificent paintings and artifacts stored in various rooms. You will get a player with different language.

title: Unbelievable art and architecture
text: The palace is breathtaking. The skill and dedication that each room holds is beyond imagination. The art and furniture at every turn is super elaborate and just over the top! The audio tour is free too. Plan to spend at least 2 hours wandering the halls and wondering how in the world an actual person painted all of those ceilings....
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: A bit boring
text: I feel itâ€™s a bit boring. Outside temperature was 34C, inner room was so HOT. There are a lot of aged furnitures. To me there are looking no much difference at all.

title: A must see when in Munich
text: For the uninitiated it does not look remarkable from outside, just another historic building among many in Munich city centre. Even as an ex-MÃ¼nchner I always thought it was 'just another museum'... until you get in. Turns out this place, which is only few minutes away from Marienplatz, the name is kind of deceptive, as it is actually a palace. The complex is huge, the interior is decorated spectacularly, so much that half way through you will wonder where it ends.And do not refer to the pictures here, they are so not reflecting the grandiosity. Hint: An audio guide which supports mutliple languages is provided free but must be collected at the counter which is coming from the cashier is opposite to the direction of the entrance/wardrobe.At the same place there is also the "Schatzkammer" (Treasure room) and a combi ticket can be purchased. However you might be exhausted after walking through the Residence - so might not be the best idea to combine both on the same day.

title: spectacular restoration with relics (photos allowed!)
text: Among the top palaces we've seen, this one has a few distinguishing features that make it stand out, including relics, extensive audio in several languages, and permission to take photos (no flash).TIP:  If you are planning on visiting 3 or more castles/palaces in Germany, consider buying the 14 day Mehrtagesticket that allows you to get into 40+ castles/palaces (26 Euros for one adult or 46 Euros for a family).Of the 2 dozen castles/palaces I have visited, the Residenz has possibly the best interior with 90+ furnished rooms full of history as far back as the 1300's, with many aspects having been restored or rebuilt after WWII. Among the many rooms, one displays holy relics (i.e., bones of saints--not for the faint of heart, so skip this room if you don't want to see them). There is an English audio guide that explains many important rooms, or you can just read the panels and accelerate your pace--the best version of a guided tour short of a personal one-on-one guide.  There are seats every few rooms that allows the visitor to rest their tired feet a bit before continuing. We took numerous photos throughout the castle, something that is not allowed at many other sites. We spent more than an hour here before we had to leave for another already-scheduled tour, but this place is worth a lot of time, and has more rooms on display than most sites.

title: Great
text: This museum is a must see in Munich, It is much more impressive inside than outside. Shell Grotto, Antiquarium, Chapel, Green Gallery, Ancestral Gallery, Throne Room are amazing. Visit Treasure to see crowns etc. Unfortunately this museum does not have A/C so summer visits may be uncomfortable.

title: A walk of interest
text: there are some special spaces here, e.g. the grotto and the Antiquarium. I included in my ticket the treasury and the Cuvillies Theatre. Both worth adding onto the ticket. A few hours here and much walking.

title: Incontournable pour les amateurs d'art et d'histoire
text: Vraiment un chÃ¢teau qui ne paie pas de mine de l'extÃ©rieur (faÃ§ade franchement austÃ¨re), mais quel intÃ©rieur ! Des piÃ¨ces somptueuses avec la galerie des ancÃªtres, l'Antiquarium, la salle du trÃ©sor, le thÃ©Ã¢tre... et tant d'autres.On y passe facilement 2 ou 3 heures, sans s'en rendre compte !On est d'autant plus impressionnÃ©s que cette rÃ©sidence a Ã©tÃ© presque complÃ¨tement dÃ©truite pendant la 2nde guerre mondiale et rÃ©novÃ©e Ã  l'identique.L'audioguide gratuit est une aide prÃ©cieuse. Les personnes Ã  l'accueil sont trÃ¨s sympathiques (notamment une dame charmante parlant le franÃ§ais).

title: Very Interesting
text: I would have loved to have seen the Residence before its wartime destruction -- it has been lovingly restored and is quite pretty to visit, but its not quite the same as seeing an original palace.

title: Nice place to visit
text: The entire museum is huge, and there is a ton to see. You gotta have the small speakers with you tho, as there are'nt a lot of information in English otherwise

title: Da vedere!
text: Residenza maestosa e da visitare in ogni sua parte con l'aiuto dell'audioguida inclusa nel prezzo del biglietto. Sotto i 18 anni l'ingresso Ã¨ gratuito e ci sono riduzioni per gli studenti e per i possessori della City tour card.Chiuso il lunedÃ¬.

title: Great place to spend a couple of hours
text: While the building clearly was very badly damaged in WW2 the building has largely been restored to its former glory.  Good value when you have students and children in tow

title: A Munich MUST SEE
text: We have been fortunate to see many of the great palaces of Europe and I must say the Residenz may be one of the best.  In addition, it is massive.  We dedicated two hours and saw many of the best parts but did not see it all.  The ticket will provide you a great audio guide.  While some of the court and crown rooms were great along with the green gallery and family portrait gallery, the two best parts were the shell grotto and the Antiquarium.  You won't find anything like this in any other palace.  Now living on the Gulf Coast and a collector of shells, I was impressed by the shell grotto and loved it.  However, the best room was the great diagonal hall with a gorgeous painted ceiling and statues from antiquity representing nearly every Roman Caesar. In addition, we bought tickets to the Treasury and theater both those are part of other reviews.For me this was one of the best things we saw in Munich and for that matter Europe.  This is a Munich MUST SEE.

title: Immensa e magnifica!
text: La Residenz Ã¨ il palazzo in cui risiedevano i principi di Baviera e merita senza dubbio una visita durante una vacanza a Monaco di Baviera. Nonostante l'aspetto esterno molto austero, gli interni sono spettacolari e per una visita approfondita occorre almeno mezza giornata. Il costo del biglietto Ã¨ molto vantaggioso e include l'audioguida con spiegazioni molto dettagliate. Da non perdere la stanza del tesoro e il teatro cuvillÃ©e che lasciano letteralmente a bocca aperta.

title: This place will keep you going for a few hours
text: Stumbled in here accidentally. Only decided to purchase the resident museum ticket as I felt that would be enough and boy was I right. You are given an audio guide and if you listen to all the talks I reckon you will easily be in here 3 hours. I stopped playing the audio tour and just kept walking around and that was more than fine. So many pieces of art and furniture, so if you love that sort of stuff this is definitely the place. The arrows to follow can be a little confusing and I do feel this can be skipped if youâ€™ve seen something similar, but otherwise this was pretty cool for 7â‚¬

title: Spettacolare
text: La piÃ¹ grande residenza in Europa. Enorme, un po' caotica da visitare, un giro tranquillo dura minimo 2 ore. Interni bellissimi anche se per la maggior parte ricostruiti dopo i bombardamenti dell'ultima guerra. Prezzo per visita completa con Teatro, 13 â‚¬.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Huge exhibit and a good place to visit on a rainy day
text: On my last day in Munich, it rained all day so I went to the museum to get out of the weather. For 7 Euros, I visited the main residence area but it easily took over 2 hours. There are so many rooms and history behind each decoration, furnishing, and design. If you're interested in learning about the lives of the Bavarian aristocracy, this is a reasonably priced and informative museum to visit. Take your time and sit when you can, because there's lot of walking. You can't bring your backpacks, but there's a free (donations accepted) bag check by the entrance. Make sure you get the audio guide, too.

title: Impresionante
text: De lo mejor de MÃºnich, es un lugar con muchas salas y es para recorrerlo con guÃ­a o audio guÃ­a, ya que resulta impresionante sus salas sus colecciones, merece la pena la porcelana, las joyas, en fin todo.Esta cerca del centro

title: Sehenswert, rechtzeitig hin gehen
text: Ideal fÃ¼r Regentag aber generell sehenswert, unweit Marienplatz.Ã–PV nutzen, Parkhaus extrem teuer.Rechtzeitig hin gehen, letzter Einlass zwar 17h aber 1 Std ist nichts, 16h war knapp und nur Residenz, Schatzkammer bereits kein Einlass mehr...Rucksack nicht erlaubt, Kostenlose Aufbewahrung, an Garderobe.Teilweise keine original Exponate, war viel zerbombt.

title: Impressively huge
text: Huge complex with three floors and 130-140 rooms to see. It will take minimum half a day to walk through the entire place; much longer if you see every room, go to the additional exhibits (e.g. treasury), and follow the audio guide. It's a good, although generic, way to see a German palace and get an impression of the scale and grandeur that German royalty was living in. The downsides are that it's not the original palace or artifacts (i.e. rebuilt after WWII), some rooms are missing artifacts, the wayfinding inside the castle is really poor, and its not particularly unique (i.e. it's more of the same if you've see other German palaces)
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Just go!
text: Go to this residence!!! Wow! Such a cool place and some of the most beautiful rooms Iâ€™ve seen in my entire life. Make sure to eat before going in - the residence area takes at least 2.5 hours to see in their entirety. So beautiful and worth every second.

title: Better than average palace tour...
text: It isnâ€™t Windsor castle, but it isnâ€™t as sparse as the average German royalty type tours Iâ€™ve seen.  Good way to at least spend a rainy few hours. Added the treasury and that was worth the extra few euros.

title: Insight into Wittelbach history
text: The Residence is like a rich maze that winds through Bavarian History. I especailly liked the ancesters hall, the Nibelungen hall and the late 18th and early-19 century roomswith the large battle paintings from the Napoleonic Wars. Give yourself plenty of time to make it through the palace and rest afterwards in the lovely Hofgarten.

title: de lo mejor de Munich
text: el lugar es absolutamente recomendable, sobre todo el antiquarium que es espectacular, pero si hay que admitir que la visita se puede volver algo pesada por lo grande que es el lugar y por lo minuciosa que es la audioguÃ­a en ciertos lugares.recomiendo empezar por el museo en lugar del tesoro, porque este Ãºltimo se hace muy muy pesado por lo extenso de las explicaciones de la audioguÃ­a.  puedes pasarte fÃ¡cilmente 4 horas ahÃ­ y no terminas de verlo todo.

title: GOOD LUCK
text: The Munich Residence is just a short walk from the Marienplatz and very popular for an interesting reason.  Many visitors feel magically attracted to the four lions on Residenzstrase.  By touching the muzzle at the lower end of the mighty shield - petting the lion's head - is said to bring good luck!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Indrukwekkend mooi
text: Dit paleis mag je niet missen tijdens een bezoek aan Munchen. geweldige collectie en schitterende zalen..
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Uren ronddwalen.
text: Wat een prachtig gebouw om in rond te dwalen. Je kunt hier echt uren doorbrengen, Tientallen zalen met de prachtigste historische voorwerpen en meubels. Schitterend gedecoreerde zalen. Je valt van de ene verbazing in de andere.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Great jewels and a lot of palace!
text: Shatzkammer has amazing surprising and wonderful objects.  Audio guide very good.  The palace has been wonderfully restored.  Be prepared to walk! There is a lot of palace here and much of worth seeing.  Pace yourself, some of the best rooms/galleries are near the end.  The enfilade of Pompeii inspired rooms are very originaland beautiful.  Keep on the lookout for some very good French furniture and gilded bronze objects scattered about the rooms.  Have fun!  Definitely worth it.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Stunning
text: Munich Residence is just a short walk from the Marienplatz.This was one of the highlights of a fantastic visit to Munich.We purchased tickets for â‚¬13 each giving access to all three areas - Residence Museum, Treasury and Cuvillies Theatre. It was worth every Euro.The Treasury reminded me very much of visiting the Crown Jewels at the Tower of London. The display is very different but equally unique and priceless work spanning several centuries.The Residence covers a large area and houses a wide range of beautifully decorated rooms, each unique in nature.One of my favourite areas was the Grotto Courtyard.The workmanship and artistry contained in this place is incredible; no more so than in the Antiquarium, Ancestral Gallery, Nibelungen Halls and Steinzimmer. To say that the Residence was stunning doesnâ€™t do it justice.Much of the Residence damaged during WWll has undergone restoration to the most incredible standard.Opening times are April - 14 Oct 09:00 to 18:00 and 15th Oct to April 10:00 to 17:00. Last admissions 17:00 or 16:00. That said you need to leave plenty of time to look around and enjoy this visit to the full.This is a must see if in Munich.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Well spent 7 Euros
text: Itâ€™s in the city so very convenient to visit, close to the shopping area. We were expecting to walk around 2 hours but we spent almost 4 hours there. We visited 90-100 rooms, porcelains, paintings. Itâ€™s one the biggest city palace in Germany. Must visit!

title: Royal Residence
text: It is in the old town and admission ticket can be taken for viewing 3 different aspects or just one or two choice is yours. The Palace is very old and retained as it is.  You need at least 2 hours to see this palace.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Breathtaking and very interesting
text: Absolutely incredible and stunningly beautiful complex of buildings. The restoration work undertaken on the sections that were destroyed in WW2 are incredible and to the average person not distinguishable from the sections that remain intact. The audio guide is excellent as is all the directional signage so very easy to navigate your way through the complex. I would suggest allowing a minimum of 2-3 hours for both the Residenz and treasury; but you could easily spend up to 5 hours as there is just so much to see and learn. Highly recommend.

title: Strapped for Time
text: If you are strapped for time, don't visit the entire Residenz. We went to the Treasury and the Cuvillees theater, a Rokkoko gem. Both are in the Residenz and manageable in 1-2 hours together. The theater is used for performances but open for visits during the day.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Good for the soul
text: It really nice to see the residence. Lots and lots of different rooms, that at the end looks all the same. There is a lot of story to hear and more to immagine. Take your time and explore it. For me, at the end was more then enough. Treasury was also very interesting.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Interesting look into Bavarian history.
text: A great example of the 15 and 16th century rulers.  Unfortunately most of this has been rebuilt because of damage occurred in WWII so it won't compare to others like Doge's palace in Venice, but interesting still.

title: Belle visite
text: Compter 2 ou 3 heures pour tout voir, c'est immense ! Beaucoup de dorures et de salles grandioses, c'est tellement grand qu'on n'est pas gÃªnÃ©s par les autres visiteurs. L'audioguide gratuit est intÃ©ressant.

title: Residenza
text: Da visitare. Ãˆ nel cuore di Monaco e rappresenta il simbolo della famiglia reale bavarese. Facile da raggiungere e fa parte del percorso delle residenze e Castelli bavaresi

title: Extraordinary museum
text: This museum has it all - opulent halls and galleries, priceless antiquities; tapestries, porcelain and bronze artifacts, furniture and paintings. It gives insights into the lives and times of Bavaria over the centuries. The entrance price of 7 euros includes a free audio guide which makes it easier to appreciate the immense collections in this expansive site. Worth setting aside 2 to 3 hours to view the inside and then there are courtyards and historical gardens to check out!

title: Da vedere
text: Merita la visita, molto belle soprattutto le prime due sale! Le sale dei Nibelunghi non sono molto facili da trovare visto che bisogna scendere al piano di sotto. Peccato solo che gran parte delle opere/sale non siano originali ma ricostruzioni.

title: Amazing residence
text: It is huge place, magnificent pictures, outstanding place You should visit itIt has museum They have parking close to itYou need at least 3 hours to see everything

title: A nice palace
text: Spent several hours here. Similar to other types of places thoughout Europe. Some very impressive things, and some that you skip over. The free audio guide was nice and informative. Able to get some history on most of the items such as tapestries, living quarters, or a nice writing desk.It's very worthwhile, especially if you have never had the chance elsewhere.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: This place is huge!
text: We purchased the 3 museum combo ticket for 13 Euro per adult which gives one entry into the Residence, The Schatzkammer and the Theatre.  Ticket is good for one visit to each and is valid for a week The Residence is massive with room after room after room looking very similar until you come to the antiquarium - in which dozens of busts and sculptures are displayed. Photo is of that room.   By the end all the small rooms started looking the same except for color.  The entire place was pretty much destroyed in WWII and was rebuilt.Audio guide (included in the price is very good if you want detailed historical descriptions of each room/chair/painting
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Breathtaking

After a little discussion on whether we were going to take it easy at the hotel or sight see some more we decided on the Residence.  What a pleasant afternoon. Beautiful architecture, decor and artifacts.  Well with the visit. You won't be disappointed.

We had a great time listening to the content on our handhelds and wandering through absolutely magnificent rooms.  We also loved the miniature painting exhibit!

title: Sublime!
text: Quel beau musÃ©e!Ses meubles d'Ã©poque,ses salons,et surtout Ã  ne pas rater les trÃ©sors de la couronne,magnifique!

title: Wonderful history
text: I love history and this is a fantastic museum that gives you a great look at what the palace once was.  Obviously a lot of the palace did not survive the destruction of the war, but they do fantastic job of telling you what is original and how close each room was to the original design.  We visited this towards the end of the day, so we were only able to see the main palace and not the treasury or other areas.  I would recommend starting here early and then heading to the Chinesischer Turm for lunch.

title: TrÃ¨s beau ensemble de bÃ¢timent Ã  visiter.

title: Who says Residence, means Palace
text: This palaces, named Residence because it is where the Bavarian monarchs resided, has nothing to envy to the rest of European palaces. It has more than 100 rooms and a really sumptuous decoration that catches your eyes and never let goes. At some point we almost lost ourselves through the halls. Really unique.

title: Desorden
text: El contenido es impresionante, salas, porcelanas, miniaturas muchÃ­simas salas pero varias cosas en contraEl orden es de los primeros sitios que la entrada y salida se hace por el mismo sitioTienes que pasar dos veces por algunas salas para hacer la visitaEl personal no es nada amable

title: It was impressive but could be skipped if time was short
text: I enjoyed the Residence but I found it very long to get through with the audio guide and by the end I just skipped a bunch of rooms. I would definitely allow for 2.5 or 3 hours if you want to do the whole audio guide. However, if time in Munich is short, I would skip it to just walk around the area and enjoy the architecture and culture.Also, I found it really difficult to find the entrance. I would suggest to the city or organizers to put more signage up.

title: Deceptively large amount of rooms!
text: You could easily spend a full day or more exploring around the beautiful palace rooms. The audio tour is very detailed and doesn't suffer from repeating or getting dull.No need for a tour guide on this trip, just get the combination ticket which allows access to the treasury as well. â‚¬11 Adult / â‚¬9 Senior

title: Immense !!!
text: La maquette Ã  lâ€™entrÃ©e nâ€™est pas trompeuse, câ€™est immense ! On plonge dans lâ€™histoire bavaroise Ã  travers plus de 100 salles... prÃ©voir plus dâ€™une heure pour la visite, sans se perdre... les audioguides sont gratuits mais nous lâ€™avons su aprÃ¨s !

title: Ben organizzata
text: L'enorme struttura comprende la Schatzkammer col tesoro, il teatro CuvilliÃ©s (controllare le aperture), ed il museo vero e proprio con un percorso ben illustrato ed esaustivo delle stanze del Palazzo. Da non tralasciare i cortili esterni.

title: Best museum I have visited
text: The extent of the display is mind blowing and the excellent audio provided in English makes everything accessible. Allow plenty of time - we were there for 5 hours and skimmed over parts of the display. Be prepared to leave for a coffee or lunch in between the residence part and the treasuryâ€™s part.

title: Beautiful Castle
text: The castle and history of it were very interesting.  We used the headphones which allowed us to listen to as much or as little as we wanted.  The residence is huge and it goes on and on as most European castle do.  We really enjoyed touring here and also toured the Treasury which is a separate part of the residence.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Bellissimo
text: Bellissimo palazzo da visitare.I ragazzi non pagano e gli adulti spendono al massimo 13 euro compreso di audio guida.La residenza Ã¨ ricca di vari oggetti e ha un sacco di stanze da visitare.Consiglio vivamente di visitarla.

title: Largest City Palace In Germany
text: The Residence is located in central Munich just a few short blocks walking distance from the Marienplatz.  It is the former royal palace of the Wittelsbach monarchs of Bavaria and is the largest city palace in Germany.  It served as the seat of government and residence of the Bavarian kings, dukes, and electors for 410 years (1508-1918).  Throughout the palace are exquisitely decorated rooms â€“ furniture and paintings, tapestries, treasures, porcelain and religious devotional items.  Climbing the Imperial Staircase you enter the Imperial Hall, the oldest and largest room in the Residence at 217 feet long.  It houses a collection of antique sculptures and busts, hence the name "Antiquarium".  The various State rooms are themselves works of art with richly decorated, walls, ceilings and floors and filled with expensive furniture and tapestries.  The richly gilded gold walls and ceiling of the Ancestral Gallery contain paintings showing the extensive ancestral history of the Elector family tree and was used to justify selection to the thrown of the Holy Roman Empire.  Within the Residence is the Wittelsbachsâ€™ collection of Far Eastern art and over 500 pieces of East Asian porcelain and lacquered items.  There is also an extensive collection of religious relics and liturgical pieces (chalices, crucifixes, etc.).  Within the Treasury, housed in a secure section of the Residence, are the crown jewels of Bavaria as well as a vast collection of jewels, royal insignia, goldsmith's work, jeweled chests, enamels, crystal objects and ivories that have been collected over the centuries by the rulers of Bavaria. At the end of the 18th century, the Bavarian prince also received the entire Palatine treasure and in the 19th century other treasures were added as a result of the secularization of many churches and monasteries.  Of note is the St George's reliquary and the Augsburg silver clock.  The Residence is open from 9 AM to 6 PM April through 15 October and until 5 PM 16 October to March.  Tours are self-guided with free audio-guide included in the price of admission.  Admission to either the Residence or the Treasury is 7 euro, 6 euro reduced rate or a combination ticket to both is 11 euro, 9 euro reduced rate.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: IncreÃ­ble palacio
text: Opulencia y lujo...salones cuyas dimensiones y contenido no habÃ­a conocido en ningÃºn otro lugar.Agradable sorpresa

title: Gambe in spalla!
text: Abbiamo visitato la Residenz dopo il castello di Nymphenburg perciÃ² eravamo giÃ  un po' provate dalla camminata. Noi abbiamo fatto il biglietto che comprende tutto quanto (Museo + tesoro + teatro) e sinceramente lo consiglio perchÃ© il teatro Ã¨ un vero gioiellino ed inoltre Ã¨ il teatro dove venivano rappresentate le opere di Wagner per Ludwig II. Servizio di consegna borse Ã¨ impeccabile e attentissimo, personale molto cordiale e audioguide molto interessanti.L'unica pecca Ã¨ che per trovare i famosi affreschi che rappresentano la saga dei Nibelunghi Ã¨ stata un'impresa e nemmeno le spiegazioni di un custode ci sono servite (la mappa non spiega molto bene i su e giÃ¹ per le scale necessari per arrivare). In ogni caso ce l'abbiamo fatta. Tenete conto che per vedere tutto quanto ci vogliono almeno due ore e mezza/tre. Potete perÃ² uscire e vedere il teatro dopo, non dovete per forza fare tutto di fila (noi abbiamo fatto una pausa per mangiare qualcosa lÃ¬ vicino).

title: Immensa
text: Molto bella e immensa, impressionante quante stanze. Devo dire che sono stati bravi a ricostruire tutto e le descrizioni dellâ€™audioguida sono ottime. Ottima lâ€™accoglienza del personale, alla biglietteria, al guardaroba Ã¨ alle audioguide. Tutti molto premurosi.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Museum visit
text: Visit was not what i expected not a lot about the history of Munich. Quite repetative on one era and focus on furnishings and art work but just quite random in that most is not where or how it was actually displayed at the time depicted. Disappointing.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Absolutely enormous!
text: This is an absolutely beautiful place to explore. But make sure you pace yourself appropriate, as you could spend hours wandering the halls if you're not careful!There are definitely some highlights (like the King and Queen's throne rooms), but you'll find that many of the less important rooms get extremely repetitive. So my advice is, if you walk in a room and nothing catches your eye, just keep walking! There are a ton of rooms to see and I guarantee you'll be fascinated at nearly every turn.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: So Worth It
text: *Do Not Use Google Maps* as is pointed out by other reviewers or you will be brought to a remote part of the building with locked doors.  We must have wasted 45 minutes. Very frustrating., intricate desing and The Residence is a beautiful inside - even thought the outside is just ok so please don't be fooled.  If you follow the audit guide completely the visit will last several hours.  Trust me, it is worth it if you have the time. The Residence has so many beautiful rooms richly decorated in gold accents, intricately detailed design, lovely fabrics, fancy furnishings, paintings, sculptures...  It really is unbelievable.  You also have the crown jewels in the Treasury: gem encrusted crowns, scepters, swords, amazing works of art and craftsmanship.I recommend getting the audio guide (included with your entry fee). This was one of the highlights of our trip to Germany.

title: Impresiona
text: Un Palacio muy bien conservado con mobiliario original que fue residencia de los monarcas bÃ¡varos hasta 1918. Puedes visitar el Teatro Cuvillies, el Tesoro y el Antiquarium, es muy grande y puedes tardar 3-4 h en verlo todo. A veces es un poco lÃ­o, te dejas habitaciones sin ver por las malas indicaciones. La audioguia es necesaria y estÃ¡ incluida en el precio, son 13â‚¬ y puedes hacer fotos.

title: Worth seeing
text: Walking distance from Marienplatz.  Definitely worth seeing.  Some of the displays are reconstructions since a substantial portion of the building was damaged during the second world war. Despite that, it was a wonderful visit for us.

title: Most Amazing place!
text: This was one of the most beautiful place I have ever seen. We stayed several hours and toured entire Residence.  The gold and detail of artwork was unbelievable during that time period.

title: Don't use Google maps to locate this place
text: We weren't the the only ones to be sent a door way via the Englisher Gardens, a door way that is locked.ğŸ˜­â˜¹The entrance to the Residence is opposite Ellis the store that sells tea coffee etc.Having duly parted with an appropriate sum of the local dosh, tickets in hand we entered the pad.Ok  it's a big pad, I mean almost endless, room after room after room, and it can get quite boring after a time as it's a bit same same different.You could omit visiting the theatre, nothing special, takes all of five minutes, well ten if u want to get your money's worth.Do however visit this posh pile, ok most of it reconstructed but it does look good.After the visual brain damage pop across to Arzmiller for a bit of r&r and large dose of caloriesğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

title: Incredible Palace with Excellent Audio Tour
text: This grand palace is very large to explore. The free audio guide is invaluable (offered in several languages) but there a plaquards in most rooms detailing what you need to know. Much of it was destroyed at different times (war,Fire etc) but much is accurately restored. Very reasonably priced, convenient to Old Town, and can be done in sections.

title: Take your time!
text: Amazing. Never ever walked through so many palace rooms. This place is enormous. All rooms have information signsin german and english that tells you the history. Go! But don't be in a hurry.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Very interesting place
text: Probably the most interesting tourist visit to make in Munich. There are so many rooms to visit and it is very interesting to see all the decorations in different colors. The display of items that were part of the local government until 1918 is very impressive and the way all the items are kept extremely good.It while take almost 3 hours to visit all the rooms and some of them are really worth the visit, like the Antiquarium, that is one the first rooms to see after starting the visit.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Magnifique
text: Dâ€™extÃ©rieur, lâ€™architecture est austÃ¨re et banale, mais lâ€™intÃ©rieur est absolument magnifique. En grande partie dÃ©truit pendant la seconde guerre mondiale, la restauration Ã  lâ€™identique est un vÃ©ritable chef-dâ€™Å“uvre. 130 piÃ¨ces Ã  parcourir selon un circuit trÃ¨s bien conÃ§u. Audio guide indispensable pour comprendre lâ€™histoire longue de la dynastie Wittelsbach qui a rÃ©sidÃ© lÃ  pendant 400 ans . Certaines piÃ¨ces richement dÃ©corÃ©es sont dâ€™une pure beautÃ©. Câ€™est immense, on en prend plein les yeux, que du bonheur. Ne pas oublier le thÃ©Ã¢tre Cuvillier jouxtant le palais. Si vous Ãªtes comme nous et que vous aimez lâ€™histoire, prÃ©voir 4 bonnes heures pour lâ€™ensemble, et encore ... LE lieu Ã  ne pas manquer Ã  Munich.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Splendid!
text: A huge collection of beautiful artifacts, jewelry and well decorative furnished residence. The glamour of those times can be seen and felt immensely. A good half a day visit.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Crown Jewels, Amazing
text: There are several beautiful crown jewels to be seen in the Treasury. The best are from the 16th century. Gem encrusted royal crowns, scepters, swords and reliquaries. Rubies, sapphires, spinels, pearls and diamond with beautiful enamel work are incorporated into these stunning works of art. There is also an audio guide. Highly recommended.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Une belle dÃ©couverte
text: Par un temps maussade, cette visite de musÃ©e fut un rÃ©gal, bien au delÃ  de nos espÃ©rance. Pour finir, la dÃ©couverte des trÃ©sors, une pure merveille.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Palacio de la dinastÃ­a Wittelsbach.
text: Residencia de 112 habitaciones con una armoniosa fusiÃ³n de estilos: renacentista, barroco, rocoso y neoclÃ¡sico que a travÃ©s de los siglos fue adoptando en su construcciÃ³n.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Grand Palace but Better Alternatives
text: Maybe I am not a huge enthusiast on European palaces (seen one seen them all is probably a little too harsh) -  because I would recommend touring the city, visiting art museum or exploring BMW museum over the palace. If you havenâ€™t been to a European palace it is worth a visit. The building was bombed during WW2 so most art and valuables arenâ€™t in original locations. Good way to spend a rainy day as you can easily spend a couple hours at the Residence.

title: Day trip
text: Unbelievable wealth from the Bavarian Kings and Princes in this immense Residence. Plan 1 day if you take the whole tour including the Residence, Treasury and the Theater ... And some comfortable shoes because you walk a lot !
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Very hard to find
text: The tourist entry to the palace is very hard to find. It's part of a huge complex with museums, theater, cafes and other unidentified buildings.The entry is not clearly marked either and because this is not a huge tourist attraction you can't just follow the crowds.Google leads you the wrong way. The only help are these small maps at the entry which don't help much. The main attraction should be clearly labeled and have some signage leading up to it.Maybe they like it this way, if people can't find it, less work for them. I gave up after 30 minutes circling around the premises.

title: Absolutes Muss
text: In diesem noch zur Innenstadt zu zÃ¤hlenden Schloss residierten einst die bayerischen KÃ¶nige. Seine Besichtigung ist sehr empfehlenswert, um nicht zu sagen ein absoluter Muss. Wir vertrauten uns einem fachkundigen FÃ¼hrer an und wurden reichlich belohnt mit vielen geschichtlichen Fakten und Ereignissen. Und besonders faszinierte uns, zu welchen kÃ¼nstlerischen und auch handwerklichen FÃ¤higkeiten man in der damaligen Zeit ohne nennenswerte technische Hilfsmittel fÃ¤hig war!

title: Portare tempo e scarpe comode
text: Martina Corvaglia, 18 anni, Liceo Linguistico Rita Levi-Montalcini, Casarano (LE)Sono stata a Monaco per cinque giorni con la mia classe e durante il viaggio abbiamo visitato il palazzo reale, uno dei piÃ¹ grandi e piÃ¹ belli di tutta Europa. La Residenz si trova nel centro della cittÃ , Ã¨ facile da raggiungere ed Ã¨ sicuramente uno di quei posti da visitare obbligatoriamente. Con le sue 130 stanze aperte al pubblico, la Residenz si rivela essere un palazzo imponente, maestoso e davvero sfarzoso allâ€™interno, questo ci fa capire infatti la potenza e la grande influenza della famiglia reale, i Wittelsbach che regnarono per tantissimi secoli. Vi Ã¨ un susseguirsi di stanze piene di mobili antichi e tappezzeria elegante, tante opere dâ€™arte affrescano le meravigliose pareti, decorate anchâ€™esse in oro. La sfarzositÃ  del palazzo, perÃ², non termina solo nelle varie stanze in cui si svolgeva sia la vita pubblica che la vita privata della famiglia reale, ma continua anche nelle sale in cui sono esposte le collezioni di ceramica e quella dei gioielli dei regnanti. La camera del tesoro, infatti, ospita una delle raccolte piÃ¹ preziose al mondo e deve essere visitata assolutamente. Il palazzo Ã¨ grandissimo, ma purtroppo non abbiamo avuto la possibilitÃ  di visitare tutte le sale e neanche lâ€™esterno per una questione di tempi e anche perchÃ© non tutte le stanze sono gratuite, ciÃ² nonostante vi Ã¨ la possibilitÃ  di acquistare un biglietto che include tutto. Dunque, Ã¨ necessario molto tempo da dedicare per visitarne una gran parte e per scoprire le meraviglie nascoste allâ€™ interno e i bellissimi giardini esterni. La visita Ã¨ molto piacevole e per nulla noiosa grazie agli audioguida che spiegano in tutte le lingue la storia del palazzo e descrivono ogni stanza in maniera accurata, dando spazio anche a delle interessanti curiositÃ . Consiglio a tutti di visitarla, poichÃ© ne vale veramente la pena, Ã¨ un edificio meraviglioso che ti lascia a bocca aperta per la sua sontuositÃ . Inoltre, il prezzo non Ã¨ eccessivo.Sicuramente una delle cose piÃ¹ belle da vedere a Monaco.

title: A Wealth of History
text: When in Munich, persons interested in the history of Bavaria and in the lives of ruling class should visit the Munich Residenz, the former royal palace of the Wittelsbach monarchs.  The Residenz, portions of which date back to 1385, is the largest city palace in Germany and is today open to visitors for its architecture, room decorations, and displays from the former royal collections.  It consists of ten courtyards and 130 rooms.  Photographs are permitted throughout this palace.

title: Great palace
text: Huge amount of rooms and extremely beautiful and variable decorations and historical artifacts. Unfortunately some rooms were ruined by the 2nd world war
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Stunning
text: You wouldn`t think it was much from the outside, but the spendour and opulence in the inside is equal to anything found in Italy. It is one of Munichs treasures.

title: Fantastic
text: Wow! From start to finish! We purchased the combination ticket and it was all outstanding . The audio guide is included. You need to change the selection button when you leave the residence and enter the treasury. Staff will help you if needed.I will just load pictures as it will save writing!

title: Unentdeckter Platz
text: Residenz und Hofgarten befinden sich hinter dicken Mauern, der Eingang ist an der Oper. Vielleicht ist dies der Grund warum Ã¼ber die Residenz vieler KÃ¶nige und FÃ¼rsten von Bayern kaum gesprochen wird. Viele interessante, prunkvolle RÃ¤ume kÃ¶nnen hier bestaunt werden. Die GÃ¤nge sind sehr lang und mannigfaltig und liefern zahlreiche Hinweise Ã¼ber die Geschichte Deutschlands, Bayerns und MÃ¼nchens.

title: Magnifique
text: Cette visite est incontournable, lorsqu'on est de passage dans cette ville joliment reconstruite. Une page d'histoire de plusieurs rois. Visite matin et/ou aprÃ¨s midi.

title: Worth 1/2 of a day
text: Massive palace of Prussian royalty. It really is 3 stories but to see everything you will need to ask for directions from the staff plus walk up and down stairs several times. The rooms are endless and much of the furnishings are authentic. We both used the audio guide and found it informative, and free with admission. All sections are well maintained. Don't miss even the porcelain and silver sections, as I usually would skip these. Staff can be quite helpful. A must visit when you are in Munich.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Second time Iâ€™ve vidited
text: This is a great place to visit. It is well maintained, contains lovely period correct furnishings, has great restroom facilities, and is quite interesting. It is one of the better royal palaces to visit. I was also there 4 years ago. Enjoyable....even the second time around.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Overwhelming, but in a good way
text: After touring other palaces in Europe that felt like you received very little for the cost of admission, this amazing spectacle gives you an enormous escape for half the cost.  There was so much to look at we actually left early because our "fantasticness pallet" had absolutely become fatigued.  Extra points for allowing photographs!

title: Herrschaftssitz

Vale a pena comprar o ticket completo e visitar a sala de tesouros e o teatro do Residenz. Por fora vocÃª nÃ£o imagina como esse palÃ¡cio Ã© lindo e cheio de histÃ³ria!!
