title: Beautiful
text: We toured the Treasuary and the Residence.  Really enjoyed the Residence but and be overwhelming and we left after about an hour.....too much for me.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Takes 3 hours to visit the Residence Museum and Treasury
text: The combo ticket for the Residence Museum and Treasury is only 9 E for seniors. We spent 1 hour in the Treasury and 2 hours viewing the many rooms in the palace - good value for the money spent. At the end of our morning visit, we were overwhelmed by the palace decor. Enter the museum from the Max Joseph Platz. About mid-way along the palace is a doorway - go through that, past a small courtyard to the ticket office. The audio desk provides free audioguides for both the Treasury and the Residence rooms. We began with the Treasury and when finished, the clerk at the audio desk re-programmed our audioguide for the Residence rooms. We found that the Treasury had items labelled in both German and English with shorter descriptions of the objects than that given on the audioguide. Definitely need the audioguide, however, for explanations of the purpose of the palace rooms and their decor. WC are located just to the right of the entry into the Treasury room - a long flight of stairs, though, up to the free WC. Another WC is behind the door marked 00 in the Grotto. WC are not marked on the layout map.We used 1 hour to see the Treasury with more time spent in Rooms 1 to 5 than in Rooms 6-10. The first 5 rooms held the Wittelbach collection of jewels, royal regalia, reliquaries while the next 4 rooms held glassware, dinnerware, and most notable a silver replica of Trajean's column. In rooms 1-5 I enjoyed looking at the 13th, 14th century crowns from Kunigundi and a spikey crown of an English Queen - all lovely with intricate gold work and blue, amethyst, and pearl settings. The small hand sized pearl studded prayer book looked well used, but the jewel studded St. George killing the dragon was dazzling - get up close and walk around the display case to see all of the detail and the thousands of precious stones embedded in the work. Room 4 was less interesting with religious monstrances but the reason behind the king having portable altars (bejewelled and gilted) was interesting when explained. In Room 5 was the crown for King and Queen during their coronation after 1800 - neither were worn, just held/placed at their feet. It was interesting to see that these 10 rooms were located in a secured area with an entry door similar to that used by banks to secure their customers safety boxes.We used 2 hours to visit the 90 rooms in the palace. Take the layout map for these rooms available at the entrance should you wish to know where in the palace you are. There are red arrows showing visitors the way to follow so no fear of getting lost. Photos can be taken and visitors walk around unguided.  Each room has an information board with a red number that is then typed into the audioguide to hear the commentary about the room. Should the commentary be overly long with its explanation, especially when it references the artists who contributed to the decor in the room, just press the "Cancel" button. Or sit on a stool in the rooms to listen to the commentary. Walking through the rooms, I think it becomes obvious where Ludwig II got the idea for his over the top gilded rooms in his Linderhof Palace. There are countless rooms, galleries, and corridors to walk through in this palace as various Wittelbach rulers extended the palace buildings. There was a change in decor with the later rulers in the 1800's but the other rooms all looked similar in their use of gilded ceiling moldings, gilded door panels, gilded table legs, and the use of luxurious fabrics. Where ceiling frescoes had been re-done after the WWII damage they lacked the vibrancy of original paintings seen in other palaces. Certainly some areas were outstanding such as the Grotto (rather grotesque actually), Ancestral Gallery, the Antiquarium Room with many sculptures of notable Romans (caesars) and 2 credenzas with majolica porcelain, private chapels with either gild and blue decor or the Romanesque brick 2 story hall (Court Church of all Saints), and the red porcelain cabinet room with mirrors. There were too many audience rooms and reception/waiting rooms. All of the palace rooms seemed to be for adults; I wondered how royal children entertained themselves or what type of rooms they had.This palace was the main attraction for me in the old town of Munich and was certainly worth the time and good value for the money spent.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Could spend days here!
text: It is massive. We went on a day we had lashing rain. â‚¬13.50 to see everything. It it stunning inside and out.

title: Gigantesco
text: Reserve algumas horas para este passeio, pois o palÃ¡cio Ã© gigantesco. Embora algumas salas sejam simplesmente magnÃ­ficas, a visita acaba ficando repetitiva no final. Diversas salas sÃ£o reconstruÃ§Ãµes de sessÃµes inteiras do palÃ¡cio que foram destruÃ­das pela guerra. Juntamente com a visita do palÃ¡cio, Ã© possÃ­vel comprar um ingresso que dÃ¡ direito a visitar a CÃ¢mara do Tesouro e o Teatro Cuvillies, duas atraÃ§Ãµes interessantes.

title: Lindo, mas muito grande

text: Câ€™est une visite dâ€™une richesse incroyable. Lâ€™aspect extÃ©rieur du bÃ¢timent nâ€™est pas engageant, mais une fois Ã  lâ€™intÃ©rieur câ€™est sublime. Photos autorisÃ©es.

title: Fabolous!
text: Take your time, there are soooo many rooms to see, you don't want to have to rush through the corridors as we did. It's great to have the time to have a closer look to details. Don't miss the crown jewels!!

title: Nice Place.
text: I only went to the residence and it took maybe two hours.  One of the security told me I could not sit on a modern chair, I think the staff use them.  She told me I didn't have time to sit and listen and I needed to hurry along.  I rushed thru and I finished way early.  Oh well.  Audio guide is good.  Bring your headphones or hold the device up to your ear.

title: visite interessante avec quelques curiositÃ©s
text: Quelques curiositÃ©s notamment en dÃ©but de visite.AprÃ¨s cela reste un chÃ¢teau assez "standart" et la visite est trÃ¨s longue.Beaucoup de piÃ¨ces Ã  visiter, de belles collections de bronze ou de porcelaine.Prevoir au moins 2 h et encore ...on a tendance Ã  finir au pas de course !

title: Magnifico!
text: Un palazzo davvero magnifico ed enorme... Prendetevi piÃ¹ di mezza giornata per visitarlo, altrimenti andrete sicuramente di fretta!Le stanze sono tantissime e il tesoro Ã¨ davvero interessante perciÃ² non saltatelo.Il costo del biglietto ne vale la pena e ricordatevi che il palazzo Ã¨ incluso nel biglietto cumulativo dei castelli della Baviera (costa 48 euro ed Ã¨ valido per due persone): risparmierete un bel po' se avete intenzione di visitare altri castelli!

title: Unbedingt besichtigen
text: Wir haben die Residenz im Rahmen einer sehr fachkundigen und sympathischen FÃ¼hrung kennengelernt. Diese mitten in MÃ¼nchen gelegene Residenz darf man sich nicht entgehen lassen. Den Besuch sollte man nicht nur auf das Residenzmuseum beschrÃ¤nken, sonst verpasst man die beeindruckende Schatzkammer und das fantastische Cuvillies-Theater. Ein absolutes Highlight in MÃ¼nchen!

title: Let down.  Not worth the time
text: This palace was completely demolished during WW2.  It was rebuild in the late 1940's or 50's but not to the grandeur expected,  Tour consisted of wallpapered rooms with limited furniture obtained from other palaces or castles.  Paneling was limited, almost all ceiling were smooth and painted with no plaster casts or moulding.  The building exterior was just plan block wall painted to visualize what it would have looked like before the war.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Take your walking shoes!
text: A must see when you visit Munich, absolutely huge and so interesting and very beautiful. Do take the audio guides otherwise it will all be a blur. Allow about 2-3 hours.Then you will need coffee and cake to recover!Gift shop bit of a let down after such a great tour.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: A must-see
text: This historical site packs a tremendous amount of interesting information, artifacts, paintings, and examples of palace living.   We actually ran out of time after being there for 3 hours.   The audio guide was excellent.   If I was to do it again, I would go first thing in the morning and enjoy everything this museum has to offer.  Highly recommended.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Residence Museum in Heart of Munich
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my trip to the residence museum and wish I had allotted myself more time! I had to rush through to catch the glockenspiel at the Marienplatz and missed about the last 30% of the museum. Definitely allot 3 hours if you want to take your time and see it all. Fantastic artworks throughout, and itâ€™s amazing to learn that many parts of the palace were reconstructed after WWII. You would never know it. Highly recommend!

title: Residenz: sfarzosa e impegnativa.
text: La Residenza dei sovrani Bavaresi di un tempo, ubicata a breve distanza da Marienplatz,Ã© un palazzo reale di rara ricchezza e bellezza. All'esterno ha un aspetto austero ma all'interno Ã© una vera sorpresa.Le 130 stanze aperte al pubblico,il teatro e la Chiesa di Corte (ora sala concerti),sono un susseguirsi di splendore e maestositÃ .Tuttavia la visita completa richiede almeno 3 ore e per alcuni potrebbe risultare impegnativa e,nel peggiore dei casi,stancante. Per tale motivo reputo inutile usare per tutto il percorso un'audioguida,in quanto Ã© mera utopia pensare di poter ricordare la spiegazione di cosÃ­ tanti ambienti.Ã‰ molto piÃº rilassante documentarsi prima, per capire cosa si va a  vedere,piuttosto che restare piantati ore ad ascoltare descrizioni di ogni singolo angolo.La sala piÃº bella Ã© l'Antiquarium,un meraviglioso salone con la volta a botte affrescata e con stupende decorazioni. Ibiglietti si possono acquistare solo in loco e io non ho trovato fila,benchÃ© mi sia recata durante le vacanze di Pasqua. I medesimi sono disponibili di diversa tipologia e prezzo; fino ai 18 anni l'ingresso Ã© gratuito.Camminare nel giardino reale  Ã© inoltre molto piacevole e l'ingresso Ã© gratuito,aperto a tutti.

title: Imperdibile
text: Un vero spettacolo in centro cittÃ . Attraversare gli stili artistici di secoli visitando un solo palazzo. Servono alcune ore per ammirare tutti i piani e le sale ma ne vale proprio la pena, assolutamente!

title: Se avete il dubbio, andateci!
text: Purtroppo il Palazzo odierno Ã¨ una ricostruzione dell'originale andato distrutto ma Ã¨ ugualmente pregevole. Con l'audioguida Ã¨ possibile gestirsi in autonomia la visita e decidere dove fermarsi maggiormente e cosa tralasciare. Vale perÃ² la pena di vedere tutto.

title: Pracht, Macht & Kunsthandwerk!
text: Ein absolutes â€Mussâ€œ fÃ¼r alle, die MÃ¼nchen, Kunst & Kultur und die Geschichte lieben! Am besten schon frÃ¼h kommen und sich viel Zeit nehmen! Den Audioguide gibt es dazu, er kann sehr ausfÃ¼hrlich sein, und um alles zu sehen & zu hÃ¶ren, reicht ein Rundgang von einem halben Tag nicht; aber man kann sich auch gut an den beigefÃ¼gten Beschreibungen orientieren. Toiletten gibt es nun auch im Bereich des Antiquariums auch fÃ¼r Behinderte, und im Obergeschoss. Zeugnisse von Jahrhunderten engagierter Sammlung der Residenz-Bewohner von der Renaissance bis im 19. Jahrhundert sind zu erleben

title: piacevole museo
text: Tempo di visita: meno di 3 ore.consiglio di portarsi gli auricolari per comoditÃ .audioguide consigliate.guardaroba (occhio a andare presto, cosÃ¬' non dovete metterlo nell'atrio.

title: Incantevole
text: Meraviglioso palazzo storico ottimamente organizzato per le visite.Le stanze sono ben spiegate da un'audioguida inclusa nel prezzo del biglietto che ha sia l'opzione di "riassunto" dell'ala del palazzo che si sta visitando, sia l'opzione super dettagliata degli oggetti presenti nelle singole stanze. I vari ambienti sono curati, ben conservati e allestiti con tappezzeria e mobilio.Siamo stati 3 ore, ma per motivi di tempo alla fine siamo andati un pÃ² di corsa.Suggerisco di dedicare ben piÃ¹ di una mezza perchÃ¨ davvero merita!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Beautiful Palace
text: We visited a lot of palaces on our trip to Austria and Germany but Munich Residenz was the best one we went to. Why? Because you tour what seems like every room in the palace!  Most palaces let you see only a handful of rooms.  We were in there for over three hours!  We mustâ€™ve picked the right day and time because we only saw one tour group and it was just the three of us in most of the rooms along with the staff.  This palace was nice.  A lot of the original items were destroyed in the bombings during WW2.  So, what you see are restored items or items that came from other palaces. We found the audio tour useless. It gives you too much information.  If you were to listen to every detail, youâ€™d be in the palace over four hours or more.  We purchased the ticket that included the Treasury, which I recommend, and the theater.

title: Magnifique, ne ratez pas les salles du TrÃ©sor
text: Mieux vaut prÃ©voir un certain temps : le nombre des salles Ã  visiter est impressionnant. Il y a un audio guide en franÃ§ais.les salles du trÃ©sor regorge de splendides piÃ¨ces : bijoux...Il ne faut surtout pas oublier de visiter le thÃ©Ã¢tre de CuvilliÃ©s qui fait partie de l'ensemble

title: PALACIO ESPECTACULAR EN CENTRO DE MUNICH
text: Es una verdadera pasada poder observar de cerca el lujo y tesoros de esta visita. Imperdible si estÃ¡s en Munich. Muy atractiva la colecciÃ³n de joyas, coronas, brillantes, etc...
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: One of the Grand Palaces of Europe
text: Since there are over 4000 photos posted of this place there is nothing I can add. I will take this rare opportunity to refrain but the sheer number of photos is proof enough of the Grandeur of this attraction.I originally visited in 2012 but was between flights and only had 1.5 hours.I didn't get past the antiquarium which is the glorious, elaborately decorated cylinder shaped room specifically built by the Emperor to house his collection of Roman antiquates. Overwhelmed by the beautify of the place I vowed to return and in March 2019 I got that chance.I found the entire palace  to be a day long outing if one wants to take everything in. There are ornate and luxuriously furnished bedrooms, works of Art, Jewels statues and other treasures to see as well as a nice gift shop to visit. I have not been to Versailles but I have been to the Schonborn in Vienna and Munich's Residence while not as big is just as beautiful. Of Course it is must see ! Can't believe how little attention it gets compared to Buckingham palace,The Kremlin etc...

title: Interessantissimo
text: Questo luogo davvero unico Ã¨ assolutamente da visitare se si Ã¨ in visita a Monaco . Situato nel centro della cittÃ  vecchia Ã¨ facilmente raggiungibile a piedi e con i mezzi pubblici. Ritagliatevi 2/3 ore e munitevi di audioguida per poter apprezzare a pieno tutto ciÃ² che vedrete . Davvero bella struttura.This truly unique place is a must visit if you are visiting Munich.  Located in the center of the old city it is easily accessible on foot and by public transport.  Carry out 2/3 hours and equip yourself with audio guides to fully appreciate everything you see.  Really nice structure.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: MARAVILLOSO
text: De los palacios que he visitado, es sin duda el mejor. Ha sido una visita que la recomiendo. Los museos no son caros. Por cierto en la tÃ­pica tienda, hay un libro que cuenta la historia de este Palacio, comprarlo es fundamental. Esta en alemÃ¡n, pero las imÃ¡genes lo dicen todo, y de paso con un diccionario se aprende alguna palabra ;)

title: Zeer mooi gebouw
text: De MÃ¼nchen Residentie is een mooi en groot gebouw. Van buiten al mooi, maar van binnen nog mooier.Entree voor residentie is 7 euro.Een combi ticket voor de residentie, schatkamer en het kleine theater in de residentie kost 13 euro.Beide zijn zeker ook de moeite waard.

title: TrÃ¨s bon aperÃ§u du style baroque rococo
text: MusÃ©e trÃ¨s riche et permettant de voir la dÃ©coration des chÃ¢teaux de Baviere. Collection de bijoux , de couronnes ..

title: Die Residenz ist einen Besuch wert
text: In der Residenz kann man sich die Geschichte der bayerischen KÃ¶nige lebendig vorstellen und das zu einem gÃ¼nstigen Eintrittspreis.

title: Largest city palace in Germany
text: Residenz is the former royal palace of the Wittelsbach monarchs of Bavaria. It is the largest city palace in Germany as the complex of buildings contains ten courtyards and displays 130 rooms. Out of the 130, you will be able to visit up to 70 of them. It takes a while, but we manage to do it in 45 min as we were out of time.Most of it has been destroyed during WWII, but it was been rebuild remarkably well. I would recommend to take the audio guide, but it goes too much specific. Reading the sights in each room is enough to get a global idea.Staff was very nice, smiling and helpful.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Fabulous building
text: Well worth a visit fabulous building the market n hall is outstanding takes around 2 hours to see building and treasures

title: Immensa!
text: Davvero incredibilmente grande e sfarzosa, non saprei come altro definire la Residenz. Con il biglietto da 13 â‚¬ si puÃ² abbinare la visita alla camera dei tesori e al teatro, che consiglio di vedere in un secondo tempo (o addirittura il giorno dopo, il biglietto resta valido) per spezzare la giornata: i pochi metri, infatti, si puÃ² fare una sosta alla birreria Spaten. Consiglio di prendere l'audioguida, comunque compresa nel prezzo, per comprendere appieno la storia del palazzo e di tutto quanto Ã¨ in esso contenuto.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Amazing palace in middle of the city
text: This was the city palace and the Residenz of the Bavarian dukes, electors and kings. It is the biggest inner city castle in Germany and today one of the most important room art museum in Europe. The whole complex is huge - he includes ten yards and is divided into three main complexes ( KÃ¶nigsbau, Maximilianische Residenz and Festsaalbau) The museum of the Residenz consist of 130 show rooms. Stylistically , the Residenz is a mixture of Renaissance, Baroque, Rococo and Classicism. Don't miss to visit the treasure chambers too. You can bay a comibi ticket for both which is cheaper. This is a must to do, bt you will need a lot of time.

title: No harm if youâ€™ve a lot of time
text: I arrived at Munich Residence at about 15:30 (2.5 hours before the closing time). When I asked to buy a triple ticket, which gives access to the Treasury, the Residence Museum and Cuvillies Theatre, the staff at the ticket office warned me that I might not have enough time to visit all three places. Thanks for her reminder but I actually didnâ€™t need a lot of time for my visit. While the Residence Museum is huge, I didnâ€™t find the rooms and the exhibits inside very interesting. Maybe itâ€™s because Iâ€™m not familiar with the history of Germany. The Treasury and Cuvillies Theatre were quite nice though. No harm spending a couple of hours there if itâ€™s your first time in Munich and youâ€™ve no other better things to do.

title: Not flexible
text: Other than the antiquarium, the rest of the exhibits / rooms weren't really impressive. They are more the same as each other and some rooms had missing items here and there. The residenz is huge and they have directional arrows to indicate which way you should walk. However there are parts where it is split into two directions. However be aware that once you choose a path, you would not be allowed to reverse. I think this is a good plan if the place is packed with visitors to allow a smooth transition from room to room, but on a day when there is minimum visitors, flexibility or common sense should be used. They basically have one attendant at every corner to enforce the above rule however my wife dropped her cardigan that was hanging off her bag at one area but when we return, it was gone. We asked the attendant and he told us he did not see anything and to go to the baggage storage area where we were also told no one returned it. I find it incredible that there was an attendant in almost every corner yet no one saw a dropped cardigan. My trust in humanity is already pretty low, thus the person who stole the cardigan did not help it farther.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Literally AMAZING!
text: Big, beautiful, better with audio guide! Nice  chambers with Kongâ€™s and Queens furniture and old beautiful items.If you like Louvre and Hermitage you should visit Residence in Munich.My guests from Russia loved it!

title: Prunkvoll, abgehoben, prÃ¤chtig
text: Ich war nicht im Museum, sondern auf Einladung des Gesundheitsministers bei einem Empfang in einem der prunkvollen SÃ¤le, Der Glanz ist beeindruckend, von der ZerstÃ¶rung im Zweiten Weltkrieg nichts mehr zu sehen,Wer sich fÃ¼r Bayern interessiert und die Vorgeschichte sollte den Besuch wagen
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Stunning Historical Attraction
text: If you are interested in history allow at least 3 to 4 hours, have a good breakfast and bring a bag with water bottles that you can leave at the entrance. We visited the Residence Museum and the Cuvilles Theatre. The Museum is the former royal palace of the Wittelsbach monarchs of Bavaria and was built in phases as each age of the royal family sought to display their status and grandeur in a style appropriate to their times. Much if the buildings are a, highly impressive, reconstruction due to war damage but this does not detract from the experience. Quite the converse, as the curators have clearly exhibited great care in selecting the contents on display, many of which are original. If your are less interested in history this is still recommended if only to wonder at the grandeur.

title: Et stort rod
text: Elendig information, vi gik rundt pÃ¥ omrÃ¥det i en time uden at finde hoved eller hale i det. Jeg har ikke mere at sige, men skal skrive 100 tegn....
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Muy lindo
text: Vale la pena ir . Con la entrada te dan una autoguia en tu idioma . De esta manera podÃ©s saber lo que hay en cada lugar . Ir con tiempo es muy grande y lleva tiempo recorrerla
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: ENORME
text: Es enorme y puedes acceder por todo. Lo que mÃ¡s nos gusto es el teatro. Precio esta fenomenal para lo grande y tambien te entra la autoguia en castellano. Pero si quieres escucharlo tranquilamente necesitas todo el dÃ­a.

title: A "Must-Visit" while in Munich
text: Of course!  You have to visit the Munich Residence (the largest city palace in Germany) while in the city. It's located almost in the Marienplatz, so it's very easy to include in your visit.Remember that there are now four parts to your visit:  The Residence Museum, The Treasury, The Cuvilles Theatre and now the Royal Palace.  All are within the same complex and begin at the ticket office, but entrances are in various parts of the interior.Give yourself two hours minimum and easily 3-4 hours if you're really interested in the history offered via free audio guide and posted descriptions.The Residence was used from 1623 through 1918 and The Royal Palace was added and used beginning in 1825. You enter the Royal Palace from room 71, first upper floor,  after you've gone into the Residence, and then wind your way around and exit the same way to continue your tour of the Residence.It's easy to miss the Treasury's entrance, so be watchful about that.Each of the four sites are different and absolutely deserve a visit.  Entry times vary, depending on the season.The best news is that, while all shops are closed on Sundays in the Marienplatz, the Residence, et al, is open.  Go early to miss the crowds.Enjoy!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Quite simply stunning
text: We grossly underestimated how long we would need here as it is much bigger than we realised. We left after 3.5 hours without seeing some of the exhibits. I would recommend getting there early after a good breakfast as there is no cafe.Then time each section as there is so much to see and the audioguide (included) is very good - but slows down progress through the museum. A must see in Munich and very easy to get to.

title: Sfarzo dei tempi che furono
text: Abbiamo fatto una coda interminabile, piÃ¹ di un ora, e poi siamo finalmente riusciti a visitare questo posto spettacolare che perÃ² fa capire le mostruose differenze tra le residenze dei regnanti e il resto del mondo....

title: Sehr eindrucksvoll
text: Von einem Raum zum anderen wird man von dem unermesslichen Prunk und Protz Ã¼berschÃ¼ttet. Alles jedoch sehr stilvoll und nicht Ã¼berladen. Der Mund bleibt offen stehen und die Augen werden immer grÃ¶sser. Unfassbar was fÃ¼r ein Reichtum sich hier befindet. Sammlungen in HÃ¼lle und FÃ¼lle, die nie benutzt wurden. Unbedingt einen Besuch wert und sehr viel Zeit mitbringen.

title: Beautiful!
text: Great museum, the triple ticket is worth it. Slightly confusing directions but a very great and beautiful place to visit.

title: Fascino "Reale"
text: Sterminata residenza che per secoli Ã¨  stata la dimora dei regnanti Bavaresi. Purtroppo come gran parte del centro storico di Monaco Ã¨  stata profondamente ferita dalla follia della seconda guerra mondiale ma con operazione straordinaria di restauro ( una vera e propria ricostruzione ) Ã¨  stata riportata quasi ai fasti del passato e comunque resa certamente godibile per i visitatori. Spettacolare la grandissima sala dell'antiquarium letteralmente tappezzata da busti e statue di ispirazione classica (molte sono copie). Il complesso di edifici Ã¨  cosÃ¬ grande che il percorso di visita Ã¨  diverso il mattino rispetto ad un accesso pomeridiano...moltissime le sale e salini riccamente decorati e sono visibili argenti e porcellane finissime che apparecchiano enormi tavolate. Sulla stessa piazza si affaccia la birreria "Spaten" sosta gradevole al termine della lunga visita.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Un lugar enorme
text: Compramos el ticket para visitar la Residencia, el Tesoro y el Teatro, y "solo" nos dio tiempo a ver la Residencia y el Tesoro. Hay que tener en cuenta que el Teatro tiene un horario de apertura distinto y bastante restringido. Pero mereciÃ³ la pena igualmente.La Residencia es impresionante, aÃºn sabiendo que prÃ¡cticamente toda ha sido reconstruida tras la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Si quieres disfrutar de la informaciÃ³n de las audioguÃ­as (gratuitas con la entrada y disponibles en diversos idiomas, entre ellos, el espaÃ±ol) debes dedicar mÃ¡s de 3 horas a la visita.Por su parte, el Tesoro alberga una gran cantidad de objetos con historias muy interesantes detrÃ¡s.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Man kommt aus dem Staunen nicht heraus
text: Die Residenz in MÃ¼nchen mit dem Residenzmuseum, der Schatzkammer und dem CuvilliÃ©s-Theater sind ein Muss bei einem MÃ¼nchen-Besuch. Diese Palastanlage wurde Ã¼ber Jahrhunderte erweitert und bietet deshalb KulturschÃ¤tze aus 400 Jahren. Eilige Besucher sollten auf alle FÃ¤lle das Residenzmuseum mit dem Antiquarium und die Schatzkammer aufsuchen. Wer die Ausdauer und Konstitution fÃ¼r mehr besitzt, sollte sich nicht das CuvilliÃ©s-Theater entgehen lassen. Im Residenz- Areal befindet sich die PfÃ¤lzer Residenz-Weinstube. Hier kann man sich bei einem gutem Tropfen Wein von den â€Strapazenâ€œ erholen.

title: Nice rooms, audio guide not so interesting
text: The rooms are nice and the tour is very well organized, with a path to follow. Informations are in both English and German and the audio guides come in several languages, are easy to use and great for self paced tours. However, after the Antiquarium (which is definitely worth a visit), all the audio guides explains is what the room was used for and where the furnishing is coming from. I expected to hear more about the history of the families that lived here, their role in the history of Germany and Europe, maybe even anecdotes...

title: Medieval palace in the heart of Munich
text: A very unique and historical place that one needs lots of time. It was the center of Bavarian royalty. I went less than two hours before closing and was only able to do the residence part with over hundred rooms and managed to just read the labels and walk through. Thereâ€™s also the treasury collection which didnâ€™t get to see.

title: June 2018: Diamonds, statues, paintings, & decorative arts - room after room; Must see!  practical tips for visiting
text: The Residenz  was a palace for the Wittelsbach dynasty.  Now, it is a modern museum.   Bombing destroyed almost all of the original building during World War 2 (Munich was the birthplace of the Nazi movement, and was an Allied target for that reason).  What you experience when you visit is a recreation of the palace; filled with paintings, tapestries, jewels, clocks, and other decorative arts.   The collectionâ€™s scope is amazing and a must-see.  The recreation includes the Cuvillies theater, a beautiful Rococo masterpiece (clearly modeled after the theater at Versailles, but more intimate and â€“ for the tourist â€“ far more accessible).  The Cuvillies theaterâ€™s interior is one of the few remaining original parts of the palace.  Before bombs destroyed the palace, caretakers disassembled the interior, and stored it out of harmâ€™s way.  The one other original part of the palace to survive is the antiquarium â€“ a renaissance hall filled with statuary and paintings.   The antiquarium alone is worth the visit.How much time: itâ€™ll take at least four hours, easily, and you may have time to walk through all the rooms, but not enough to immerse yourself in the exhibits.   One could spend the whole day â€“ maybe two â€“ to see everything.Tickets: you can buy tickets for the residenz or the theater, or both.   Do both.   The best ticket is the Mehrtagesticket â€“ 44 Euros â€“ for two adults for 14 days to visit all the Bavarian state museums and gardens.  It will get you into the museum and theater.   Kids 18 and under are free.Getting there: donâ€™t drive.  Use buses or the underground.   The closest underground stop is Odeonsplatz. Alternatively, you could hop off the U at Marienplatz, see the Rathaus and the animatronic clock, then walk to the Residenz (or vice-versa).  Buses are also easy to use.  Alternatively, you could rent a bike.  Thereâ€™s a huge bike rack in the Max Joseph Platz.  Note: bikes are big in Munich â€“ theyâ€™re everywhere.  Strangely, Germans, for the most part, donâ€™t seem to wear bike helmets.  If renting a bike, Iâ€™d sure get a helmet.  Thereâ€™s a lot of automotive traffic on the streets and lots of pedestrians in the pedestrian malls; all making for potential spills that could ruin a trip in a moment.Who will enjoy:  Adults and teens who can appreciate history and/or art will enjoy the visit.  Anyone younger than 13 will likely endure the visit, but with not that much humor.Staff:  they speak enough English, for the most part, to help you get by.  As always knowing some German is not only polite and greatly appreciated, but also an excellent way to truly enjoy your visit.Food: you can find something to eat at a couple wine bars on Residenzstrasse, or other restaurants nearby, but not in the museum.  If you want water, like the rest of Germany, you need to pack your own.   Water fountains seem to be an American thing.  You can refill your water bottle in the WC.Entrances:  there are two that count â€“ from the Residenztrasse and Max-Joseph-Platz.  The platz entrance is the easier to use. These are the only two entrances that get you to the ticket desk.  Go here first, then go to the other entrances to see courtyards and the theater.Selfie sticks:  leave them at home.  Theyâ€™re verboten!!  And, the staff is obsessed with keeping them out of the museum.Prepping for the weather: even in June, it can get cold and you can get soaked with rain.  Our day in Munich was rainy and mostly in the fifties to sixties.  We had umbrellas, (courtesy of our hotel) and they were worth the trouble of carrying as otherwise weâ€™d have been soaked.  Make sure you pack a sweater, at least, and, to be well prepared, a water resistant wind-breaker.

title: Una delle Residenze piÃ¹ grandi al mondo!
text: Bellissima Residenza, con tantissime stanze e tanti particolari dell'epoca. All'interno si trova il "Tesoro" dove vengono mostrate corone dal valore inestimabile appartenute alle regine. Consiglio di visitare la residenza al mattino poichÃ© essendo molto grande vi ruberÃ  tanto tempo.

Como solo tenÃ­amos una hora para la visita compramos solo la del palacio y cuÃ¡l es mi sorpresa cuando al salir veo que tenemos que pasar por la sala del tesoro, asÃ­ que no entiendo por quÃ© existen estos dos tipos de entrada, ya que al final pasas de todos modos por esta sala. El palacio merece la pena, te dan con la entrada una audio guÃ­a que puedes escuchar en espaÃ±ol. La sala de baile es impresionante. Merece la pena dedicarle unas horas.

title: Impressive restoration
text: The Royal Palace (Die Residenz) is in the heart of the City. Schatzkammer (Treasury) and the 130 rooms are well worth a visit, not only for their grandness, but merely for the huge and detailed restoration work (after destruction in WW II) that has been done by the craftsmen.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Enooorme
text: Como residencia palaciega europea cumple a la perfecciÃ³n. Bonito, no defrauda, aunque similar a otros europeos. Es una visita entretenida.

title: Die grÃ¶sste innerstÃ¤dtische Residenz, neu renoviert
text: Die ResidenzrÃ¤ume des MÃ¼nchner Winterpalastes sind frisch renoviert worden und die meisten sind der Ã–ffentlichkeit bereits zugÃ¤nglich, bis auf das gelbe Treppenhaus. Der Eintritt ist 7,00â‚¬ fÃ¼r einen Erwachsenen, es gibt eine groÃŸe Garderobe und einen Shop im VestibÃ¼l. Operparkgarage, aber nicht billig.Besonders die neuen ParkettbÃ¶den mit aufwÃ¤ndigen Intarsien, der rosarote Kunstmarmor im KÃ¶nigin-Treppenhaus, die trompe-l'oeil WandbehÃ¤nge und die schÃ¶n angeordneten DisplaykÃ¤sten mit feinstem Nymphenburger Porzellan und Tafelsilber sind beachtenswert. Witzig sind die von Klenze entworfenen KÃ¶nigin- und KÃ¶nigspapierkorb in den SchreibsÃ¤len.Die bisherigen RÃ¤ume wie Ahnengalerie, Muschelgrotte und Antiquarium sind fÃ¼r den Besucher offen. Da die Residenz weitlÃ¤ufig ist, sollte man Zeit mitbringen und auch eine Jacke fÃ¼r die kalten Bereiche.

title: One of Europe's most significant interior decoration museums.
text: With the Residence, Munich owns one of Europe's most significant interior decoration museums. open to visitors for its architecture, room decorations, and displays from the former royal collections.Entrance fees: 7â‚¬.Visit Duration: 2 Hours.The residenz lack signs or a tour map since you can be lost, you williss visiting some rooms or see twice the same.The 1385 small castle was transformed by the rulers over the centuries into a magnificent palace, Munich Residence served as the seat of government and residence of the Bavarian dukes, electors and kings.The exquisite decoration of the 130 rooms have been filled with furniture, oil paintings, tapestries, treasures, religious devotional items and porcelain from the best artists of the time.Since the palace was in permanent extension you will enjoy the mix from renaissance style that extends via the early Baroque and Rococo epochs to Neoclassicism.The highlight of your tour will be in: 1-Antiquarium: the largest and most beautiful Renaissance hall north of the Alps was built  for the antique collection of Duke Albrecht V and later used as a festival hall.2- Treasury of the Residence with the  unique gold work, precious works made of mountain crystal and ivory, gems, jewelry, tableware, the Bavarian crown insignia. 3-The Byzantine Court Church of All Saints (Allerheiligen-Hofkirche).

title: IncreÃ­ble
text: Este es uno de los palacios mÃ¡s asombrosos que hemos visitado en Alemania. Es un palacio realmente sorprendente, lleno de salas y habitaciones. Pero lo mÃ¡s especial es que estÃ¡ lleno de objetos y de mobiliario de la Ã©poca. AdemÃ¡s esta lleno tambiÃ©n de cuadros, frescos y esculturas. Para nosotros es la visita imprescindible de Munich. Para visitarlo es necesario entre 2 a 4 horas ya que hay dos recorridos. Nosotros realizamos la ruta rÃ¡pida y tardamos 2 horas. Y despuÃ©s estaba la ruta lenta que era una hora mÃ¡s de visita. Las visitas pueden hacerse libre o visita con audioguia. Lo mejor es que se puede tomar fotos sin flash y hacer vÃ­deos en su interior, es de los pocos palacios de Alemania donde estÃ¡ permitido.

title: A must see
text: While in Munich, visit the Residence and the surrounding sights.  Use your imagination and put yourself in a royal frame of mind.  You will enjoy.

title: Fabulous treasures and great history!

Royal appartments, chapels, reception rooms etc etc. But a real treasure is the Hall of the Niebelungen where there are pictures and history of the characters featuring in Wagnerâ€™s The Ring of the Niebelung.

text: Residenz Munich is rich in history, you can almost smell it! Like literally. It smells old but itâ€™s grandeur makes up for it. Beautiful artifacts and takes you deep into how people were living back then. Highly recommended.

title: Great treasury!
text: We spent good 3 hours in this place and I was happy that we started with Treasury. Amazing collection with proper masterpieces. I was well surprised it wasnâ€™t packed! We almost had full museum to ourselves. You get audio guide together with your entrance tickets. It has interesting commentaries.Interiors of Residence are very impressive too! Different styles and good mix of rooms and furniture. Really enjoyed our visit. If you have only limited time- go and see Treasury!

title: Beautiful
text: Must see!!! We did not have much time to explore the entire museum but we enjoyed what we were able to see. P.S : The older male ticket agent is not so friendly. Avoid going to him. No need for something like that to damper your visit to such a beautiful place. The ladies are very sweet and happy.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Must see!
text: We hadnâ€™t known of Residenzâ€™s existence until we planned to travel to Germany.Itâ€™s like the Palace of Versailles or the Buckingham Palace.Lion statues holding a shield are located on either side of the gate and itâ€™s said that those bring fortune to you if you touch the shield.There were a wide variety of architectual style, well furnished rooms and treasuries in the premises.I canâ€™t find adequates words to express its fabulousness enough.I think Residenz has a low profile in Japan but itâ€™s difficult say which is better, the Palace of Versailles or Residenz.Both of us were completely fascinated!

title: Visita alla "residence"
text: Palazzo imponente, se non fosse stato quasi completamente bombardato e quindi poi ricostruito sarebbe uno spettacolo unico!!! Comunque le stanze sono state restaurate e belle come se fossero le originali!!!

title: Eyes and Legs both worn out!
text: This was a great place to visit... so many fascinating things to see. The treasury area off to the right after you enter is full of gilded swords, an amazing statue of St. George, and other treasures. It is well worth the side trip. Walking through the various rooms, imagining how people lived here, seeing amazing tapestries and statues and busts and dishes and relics. This is a great place. We wandered for a few hours.

title: Una Residenz Spettacolare!
text: Residenz, il Palazzo Reale di Monaco di BavieraUna residenza imperiale di una maestositÃ  e dimensione da lasciare senza fiato.SI stratificano storie e sovrani e il tutto diviene un museo naturale ricco e prestigioso.Magnifiche le camere e gli arredi. Sorprendenti i materiali profusi senza lesinare per nulla. Marmi, stucchi e decori in abbondanza da lasciar senza parole anche fosse solo per l'immane spreco a carico dei sudditi.Sorprendenti i suppellettili e corredi legati alla regale quotidianetÃ .L'imponenza del palazzo Ã¨ data dal suo esser stata fortificata.L'imponenza e dimensione da perdersi consiglia l'audioguida.Spettacolare merita il biglietto!

title: A treasure trove
text: It is packed with treasures - interiors are magnificent and rich in decor. It has a great collection of porcelain and silver, too.it is a whole complex of interconnected buildings and one may spend a whole day here, also visiting a crown jewels collection and a theater.The complex was damaged in the WWII and you may see, how meticulously and painstakinly it is being restored.

title: Well worth an afternoon
text: We took three hours to see the treasury, residence and the theatre. Apart from the odd museum type sections we loved every bit of it.  The building has been restored and maintained to reflect the design of its original comstruction periods.  it is Germanyâ€™s answer to Versailles.

title: Assolutamente da visitare
text: Le visite sono 3 e si possono acquistare biglietti separati o cumulativi, una per il palazzo, una per il tesoro e lâ€™altra per il teatro.  Eâ€™ assurdo che nonostante il notevole afflusso di visitatori ci siano solo 2 casse aperte. Lâ€™audioguida (gratis) Ã¨ solo per il palazzo e il tesoro.  Dopo la fila per acquistare il biglietto, si lasciano zaini o borse ingombranti al guardaroba. Per il teatro occorre uscire e quindi rivistersi.Il palazzo Ã¨ veramente grande ed il percorso labirintico, anche se segnalato, poichÃ© su piÃ¹ piani. Nonostante lâ€™attenzione  e la cartina, un ala lâ€™abbiamo saltata. Seguendo le indicazioni per il percorso piÃ¹ lungo si ridiscende alle stanze dei nibelunghi, da lÃ¬ si puÃ² uscire ma non piÃ¹ rientrare nel percorso museale (perdendo ad esempio la galleria degli antenati) quindi si ci vede costretti a dover ritornare indietro.Nonostante tutto Ã¨ unâ€™attrazione di Monaco che va assolutamente visitata. Molto Ã¨ ricostruito ma in ogni caso rimane intatto il fascino per questa dimora storica. Le audioguida sono eccessivamente lunghe per cui conviene soffermarsi su quelle che vi attraggono di piÃ¹.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Meravigliosa Residenza regale
text: Venire a Monaco e non visitare la Residenz dei monarchi di Baviera sarebbe un grosso errore. La dimora regale Ã© bellissima, sfarzosa e molto grande, con i soli 7 euro del biglietto d' ingresso si passa di stanza in stanza, una piÃº bella dell' altra, immergendosi in molti secoli di storia bavarese. Sebbene un' ampia ala della residenza sia andata distrutta a seguito dei bombardamenti alleati durante la II guerra mondiale, gli ambienti e gli arredi, anche quelli ricostruiti, rimandano perfettamente al fascino di un tempo perduto. Prendetevi almeno 2-3 h per visitarla tutta con l' ausilio dell' audioguida compresa nel prezzo e non ve ne pentirete!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: residenz
text: palazzo reale richiede una giornata di visita tra stanze modello Versailles e tesori, gioielli e mobili

title: Wonderful - once you find the entrance
text: A very enjoyable tour of the Residenz.  The rooms are well decorated, and beautifully restored.  There are handheld audio guides which tell you how long the audio tour can take - with the option for extra information on specific pieces within the collection.My only criticism is that the entrance is not well sign-posted.  We spent a long time walking around the building looking for an entrance.

title: Beautiful
text: The Residenz is a beautiful city palace with the Antiquarium being the highlight for me. The only negative is the chaotic entry hall and ticket purchasing situation. I canâ€™t imagine what it would be like on a truly busy day. Nonetheless, I highly recommend it.

title: Beautiful museum, don't miss the Treasury
text: My husband and I toured the Residenz while using the audio tour.  We really enjoyed ourselves and learned  a lot about Bavarian history.  Definitely see both the palace living quarters and the Treasury; it's worth it.  Allow a minimum of two hours, three would be better.The Residenz was the in-town home of the very wealthy ruling family of Bavaria, the Wittelsbachs.  The first buildings at this site were erected in 1385.  The Treasury houses the riches of the Wittelsbach family that ranges in time from the early Middle Ages to the Neo-classical period.  It includes the crown of the English Princess Blanche (Blanche of Lancaster), the oldest known surviving crown of England.  When she married into the Wittelsbach family it became their property as part of her dowry.  It is also known as the Bohemian Crown or the Palatine Crown; it is thought to have been made after about 1370 and is the best surviving example of Gothic goldsmithing.  It looks as if it would belong to a fairy-tale princess.  It, the Bavarian Crown jewels, the Crown of Therese of Bavaria, and the statue of St. George and the Dragon are the absolute highlights.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Merita una visita
text: A dire il vero ho visto residenze reali europee molto piÃ¹ belle, ma questa merita comunque una visita. Ci sono delle sale molto, molto belle

title: History pure
text: Residence Munich is a place where history is stored. The best of is the treasury room which you shouldn't miss.

title: Its HUGE
text: Almost entirely destroyed in WWII, this has been entirely rebuilt and carefully curated to WOW at every turn. Rich with information regarding the history, architecture and furniture, the audio guide is excellent and there is a handy cloakroom so you can meander at your leisure. And to make sure it is a pleasure, don't do all of it! Try to see the big halls (green room and state apartments among these) and then just pick your way between those. There is too much for one day. Children under the age of . . . well children age will be bored out of their skulls so don't bother. There are some good attempts at wheelchair accessibility. Even if you don't go in, check out the facade and the squares as they are beautiful.

title: An example of how historical places must be preserved and presented
text: Cooking from a Country where most of art treasures are I was really admired how such a monumental sure was recovered after the 2nd world war bombing and given back to the people. Beautiful palace and amazing art pieces a must see in Munich
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Visita oltremodo rapida
text: Abbiamo cominciato la visita nel primo pomeriggio, facendo il biglietto solo residenza. La signora ci ha detto che dovevamo essere veloci per vedere quasi tutto, ma nonostante la rapiditÃ  alle 16.30 ci hanno giÃ  fatto incanalare verso l'uscita (chiusura effettiva 17).Quindi non siamo riusciti a vedere tutto, ma avendo visitato altre residenze reali, questa appare come una serie interminabile di sale udienza, gabinetti e sale ospiti... Insomma, preventivate almeno un po' di ore o una mezza giornata abbondanti per una visita completa e a mio giudizio Ã© una visita bella ma non imprescindibile. Audio guida in italiano gratuita ma un po' prolissa.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: residenz... di lusso!!!
text: Splendido palazzo residenza dei regnanti bavaresi con camere molto belle e ben tenute, utile audioguida compresa nel prezzo. Non da trascurare il fatto che sia facile da raggiungere dal centro cittÃ . Tutto ok!
